isle of silence

LQCC - 🚢│docks
LQCC
🌁 ISLE OF SILENCE / 🚢│docks
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 21-Dec-22 11:24 AM
◉ DID YOU HEAR IT? WORK CALLS. You received the [CASE] this morning, prefaced that it was an [“ODD”] one, but by now, many of you know that “Odd” is the norm in your line of work. This one, though, perhaps was a little more unnerving, instead. It was another [MISSING PERSON] case, or rather.. [MISSING PERSONS] and quite a big number of them at that. Which was why [TWELVE] of you were sent for this mission. Your client was a detective from MCPD named [ROBERT BELLAMY], a name perhaps a couple of you have heard of at least because he seemed to procure your help often enough. Along with the case file, he’s also sent you a [PHOTOGRAPH], and had underlined the fact that every detective that will come for the mission, must be chosen carefully.#Which is where the unnerving part came.Robert requested that the detectives to come, are those who can [SEE “IT”]
11:24
At a glance, it is simply nothing more than an amateur picture of a quaint island on the lake. #You were informed it was Lake Michigan. But then you were told that some others in your agency, and then some few more who has seen this [picture…]-THAT THEY DON’T SEE AN ISLAND AT ALL. ---Just The Lake.And now, driven by some of your [COWORKERS], you arrived at the scene.- time: 08:00AM + location: RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT BY LAKE MICHIGAN … We Saw Nothing - Michael Tontsch
https://soundcloud.com/bat-660535871/we-saw-nothing-by-michael-tontsch-1
~30 minutes till start!
11:24
@silence
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 21-Dec-22 12:03 PM
The arrival was interesting, some of you were driven by [RENA], then others by [CAMERON] and a handful of others by [ASHLEY]. It was an interesting time on the road. One who went with Rena had a fairly pleasant drive, other than the rather dated choice of music, it was mostly uneventful. Any attempt at changing stations would result in a tight slap on the hand. The one driven by the other two, however, perhaps had a rather touching moment with their fellow coworkers. #literally. To say the least, a [RACE] happened, and you didn’t expect the two people with the most pleasant smiles would drive like that of two demons. However, you still arrive [SAFELY], even amidst the car honking and tire screeching.[NOW ONTO THE JOB AT HAND]The [RESIDENTIAL AREA] is rather quiet from the common folk and residents, it is instead filled with dozens of agents, similar to you. A few [MCPD] are seen as well a good number of [CRISIS CREW]. Among the crowds however, perhaps a couple of you might notice the familiar face of your [CLIENT]. ◉ AS OF NOW, YOUR INFORMATION IS THUS:
There are more than a dozen of people missing as of now that was reported, a large number of them had been confirmed to be related to the case, others, are still up in the air. The Photograph that was sent to you was taken by one of the missing persons and found in their personal belongings. It has been confirmed that only a set few can see the Island on the Lake. It has been assumed that the missing people left for the island, some few evidence suggested this, but nothing detailed in the file yet. As of now, it is unsure what being able to see the island or not may imply, but only those who can search for the victims within the island, are those who can see it.
With that.. [What would you like to do?] @silence
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:09 PM
It's been a while since she's been on a mission like this, with proper field work and all. It was a bit exciting to be honest, but they're not going into this head empty. They've all got important work to do, and she need to put on her best as one of the senior. She got lucky (?) and ended up in Rena's car - a nice and cozy drive. So cozy in fact, that she slept through most of it. Once there, she rolls out of the car with a yawn, still not fully awake. Though the cold's slowly nipping at her, shaking her back to conscience. :hides:
Ophelia Leclair BOT 21-Dec-22 12:13 PM
Having been driven by Rena, Ophelia feels fine after the car ride! Of course, the telltale sign of nerves were looming over her head, especially considering the strangeness of this place... But, what case of theirs wasn't that way? Stepping out of the car, her amber eyes glazed over the surroundings and the client in the distance. The mcpd and crisis crew also caught her attention, crossing her arms in a futile attempt to get a little warmer. At least she brought a warm coat and a scarf, as per usual. Time to get to business... The number of missing people was alarming enough as it is.
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 21-Dec-22 12:16 PM
It was chilly by this side of the lake. Doris rubs her gloved hands together though that didn’t do much to aid with warmth. It’s been awhile since she’s been on a bigger case like this, she wonders momentarily if she prepared enough for this. She huddles close to Jamie as they all exit the vehicles. Cameron’s car is always a fun ride. She had managed to get a bit of rest while on the drive here, even if it was just a little tight in the back seat. She spots the MCPD and Crisis crew, who are the clients exactly? Why did so many people head off in towards a mysterious island that only some people can see? “What do you think of the photograph?” She asks Jamie as she wraps her scarf around her neck a little tighter. “It was kind of like those ghosts pictures right?” @pepomint 📸 jamie/shaun/darren
5
Peregrine (any) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:17 PM
To be perfectly honest, Peregrine hadn't quite sorted through their feelings on this mission. Their last one had landed them in the hospital for a short stay, but they didn't quite feel the apprehension or dread that perhaps a normal person would as they barrel towards an even greater danger. Just a determination to get things done, do the best they can, grab photos when needed. Maybe even a bit of excitement at what lies ahead. They had the pleasure of arriving with Cameron, even awarded the privilege of being shotgun! The little street race was certainly a wake up call, and to them, rather fun. If anything, they absolutely enabled it, telling Cameron to drive even faster and taunting Ashley from their window when they occasionally passed by. When they arrive at the scene and come out of the car, their hands immediately go to their camera to snap a few shots of the crew and MCPD. As they wave out the photo to develop, they side-step their way over to Frankie. "You brought the stuff I packed you, right?" He was like a little wet kitten to them and got scared so easily in their apartment, they felt the need to pack him a bag like a school child. Snacks, first-aid, pepper spray (for safety), knee guards (for extra safety). That sort of stuff. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie
Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 21-Dec-22 12:18 PM
Hayden’s been in this rodeo more times than she has fingers and toes to count on at this point so she just relaxes, kicking her feet up on Rena’s dashboard throughout the ride, as if it’s her car or something. Claiming shotgun should come with some sort of luxury! Hayden stretches as she gets out of the car, sighing as she strides over to their client’s familiar face. She’s seen the guy plenty of times, on her very first mission at LQCC no less! “This better not be some elaborate prank, Bellamy,” Hayden casually greets the man. “What’s up with this whole mystery island business, mate?” @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:21 PM
Well. He made it in one piece and it must have been the spirit of giving or something because he saw his life flash before his eyes several times this morning already. He may not totally believe in a god but there was definitely one testing him, and Cameron too, perhaps. There were a few attempts at small talk during the ride until Cameron revved the engine up and Frankie paled, he didn't think he could miss the ground so badly after a 'short' drive, but the temptation to kiss the grass is there. Shoving his hands in his pockets to spare them from chilly winter air, he observes the residential district, waving so the agents that catch notice of him to a small 'hullo' and 'morning to you too.' Brought out of observational stupor by Peregrine's question, Frankie gives them a lopsided smile. "Course', I have everything packed nicely I even brought extra pairs of socks incase snow gets in one of our boots." He pauses, shivering. "God, it's cold." @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:21 PM
"Mm, strange for sure..." She also huddles closer to Doris for warmth. Her voice still sounds a bit drowsy. "At first I thought it might've been tampered with? But it looks too... real. For that." And the fact that only a select few people can see what's really on it... It made her feel just a bit uneasy, they don't deny it. "Do you think it's maybe anomalous?" @deefrost 🌼 doris 🎸 rose
Ophelia Leclair BOT 21-Dec-22 12:22 PM
She follows after Hayden towards the client with a polite smile. "Good day... Is there any particular theory on why only we could see it, or is that still a mystery?" She asked, tapping her chin in contemplation. @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷 @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Maeron Al Najjar BOT 21-Dec-22 12:22 PM
Second mission to date, and it was one abundance in much more gravitas than the last. Maeron couldn't help but keep silent observation of the more experienced detectives he rode alongside in Detective Byrdford's car, wondering how such things were usually handled among them. After all, Maeron had never concerned himself with looking for missing persons before-- and was this a common concern they had to encounter? Utterly dreadful. His wariness is only met with more apprehension after exiting the vehicle. The situation certainly seemed to be garnering attention on a scale that was easily indicative of how dire its circumstances were. Dubious photos of an island in a lake adding an ominous note to the whole affair. It was clear that the next step was, undoubtedly, to follow the missing people to the island. They weren't here after all. So, being their only lead, they would have to follow them there. And Maeron was not quite feeling the most enthused about the prospect. But work was work, and he had to at least seem somewhat committed to it.
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:27 PM
This is already a lot different than her last mission. As in, Miette's pretty sure she met God on the car ride here. Ashley drives like a demon with a death wish for all of them— who'd have thunk it?! That placid smile hides a monster. ...but at least it woke her up, she guesses. She fixes her hair, her scarf— time to focus. Missing people- she's. Kind of dealt with that? But this feels a little different... she hides her hands in her coat and huddles near the back of the gathering group, looking around at the site.
Robert Bellamy BOT 21-Dec-22 12:28 PM
Robert was there, of course, he was the one who called you this time as well, you do see him speak to another man, someone from Crisis Crew you think, but upon hearing his name he turned to face you, Hayden, and the rest of LQCC for that matter, and so did the other man. He smiles and waves, "Ah, Detective O'Connor, and all of LQCC! I know I was the one who said all hands on deck, but there are quite a lot of you aren't there!" He chuckles, before nodding. "But I assure you, it's not a prank." He then turned then to Ophelia and shook his head, "As of now there isn't a concrete reason why, but whatever theory I can think of, well. I don't think it can be very pleasant, but hopefully with more heads to think it through, it will be solved soon." @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷 @lolocane 🥂 ophelia
Soma Lee (He/him) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:28 PM
"Thank you for having me," he wants those words carved on his gravestone. His final words before he got in Ashley's car. Soma had no idea a car could even go that fast... Or make that... That noise. At the end of it all, Soma could positively say that he has aged a few years... Even as he finally got out of the car, he swayed a little. He would feel like he's still in the car for a while longer. "Sucks that we lost the race," he says good-naturedly. If he was going to die in a car crash, shouldn't they at least win?? But hey, silver linings! They're here in one piece! Just like Ashley said he would be.
Peregrine (any) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:29 PM
Oh thank god. There's a wave of relief as Frankie speaks, thankful he hadn't forgotten it at home or something. They trusted him to be a capable adult of course, but... still. They did not want their roomie to die because that'd suck. "Yeah, it sure is," they laugh out, pulling their scarf a bit tighter around their neck. They didn't usually mind the cold all that much, but it wasn't the kind of weather they were best acclimated to. They knew how to dress for it at least, thoroughly bundled up with even a scarf and some gloves on. They kept it fairly practical though instead of their usual cuter stuff, partially to avoid ruining it, partially to avoid it ruining them in a poor situation. "Let's just hope it'll warm up the later it gets. If you get too cold, you can just hold my hand or somethin' though, okay~?" They're teasing. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie
ASHLEY WALKER BOT 21-Dec-22 12:30 PM
"truly, I wonder if it's cause I didn't go fast enough" :thinkies: @ soma

Magnolia Faragher BOT 21-Dec-22 12:30 PM
Magnolia had her eyes on the case files for the entire journey, not saying much as the cars close in to their destination. Logically, she knew that Malachy should have already recovered enough to be left by himself, yet....after the whole ordeal that her son went through, she's not sure if she's really in the mood to do field work. Ridiculous. Any other time, she would have been delighted to be involved in such an interesting case. She looked around the team, detectives with varying level of experience...only 3 who had been in LQCC longer than her....damn, she gotta get her shit together, The detective shoved her personal thoughts away as she shifts gear to work mode. Thankfully, her coworkers already had a head start on questioning and she moved closer to listen in their conversation.

Robert Bellamy BOT 21-Dec-22 12:34 PM

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 21-Dec-22 12:36 PM
One of the last to exit Ashley's car, detective Bernette had stepped into the backseat, found a comfortable spot to curl up and make herself as small as possible, and slept quite pleasantly despite the car chase. One foot, then the other, as she steps out onto the gravel with a stretch and yawn. Bundled up in a big coat with a knee-length maroon skirt and thick black leggings, she shuffles towards the back of the group and listens. Truthfully, she's a little irritated - when you're prepping for time off work, the last thing you want to be told is only you and a handful of others can see a stupid island on a stupid picture.
8
Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 21-Dec-22 12:36 PM
She sighs heavily as she exits Walker's vehicle. Eclaire hadn't even bothered to tell Walker to knock it off for everyone's safety--too busy furiously bracing herself for the worst--and somehow feeling disappointed that they had 'lost' (at least win, damn you!). Already she was thinking of trading places with someone from Byrdford's on the way back. She makes her way over to the rest of the detectives huddled around the client to listen in on the details. Making a very obvious turn away from Al Najjar while the corner of her mouth twitched at the sight of his miserable mug. Hope there aren't kids in here to be mean to this time!

Robert Bellamy BOT 21-Dec-22 12:39 PM

santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 21-Dec-22 12:40 PM
◉ TO FILL IN THE BLANKS, HERE IS THE BRIEF. There has been a large number of [MISSING PEOPLE] around this area specifically, at least a dozen, maybe two even, as you can guess, few of them were properly reported, and it was only recently that we discovered that a large number of them were related to one another. After further investigation, we’ve surmised that these particular missing people have left for the [ISLAND].- THE ONE FROM THE PHOTOGRAPHBe it from [JOURNALS] or [WITNESS ACCOUNT], all who are related to this have mentioned the existence of the [ISLAND], and more than that.. [Being called to them]. This was further speculated when the local fisherman store has been getting quite the number of requests to [RENT BOATS], but none have been returned, furthermore. In the lake, a [BODY] has been discovered. One of the listed missing people, a recent one. And yes, a witness has mentioned that they have spoken of the island prior to their death. Along with that, the missing people seem to have some semblance of [Difficulties] in their life. Be it mixing in with the wrong crowd, trouble at school, trouble with family, in some manner of way they have varying degrees of [Distress]. I’m not quite sure if that is related but, I figured I should mention that as well. Now, as for the number of agents, you may have noticed that there are a number of [CRISIS CREW] with us today, it is due to the number of [MISSING PEOPLE]. You are the anomaly specialist, but to force both dealing with the island-sized anomaly on top of getting all the missing people to safety will be tough. So these people will be in charge of ensuring the victims get to safety, so you can focus on doing something about that [ANOMALY].[…Any questions?]

You can always hold my hand if you're nervous." From a distance, Frankie watches the others greet the briefer. He trusts the seniors to be able to ask the right questions. "Do you think you'll be able to get some good pictures of the island?" He asks his roommate, wondering if the island will just disappear after this case is resolved. It sounds mystical, if not the spooky stuff of legends, not having seen anything anomalous of this scale before. @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine

santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 21-Dec-22 12:58 PM
[MAERON:] No, since we know it is of anomalous nature, we were hesitant to send MCPD without the aid of an anomaly specialist, even with readied equipment. Especially considering the fairly recent connection between the missing people and the island. [HAYDEN & OPHELIA:] Yes, it was the only body, but no, there are no wounds or abnormalities. It seems the body that was found perished trying to swim to the island, due to the shortage of boats to be rented, there was none left for them. So the victim died of drowning. [MAGNOLIA:] yes, the photograph was found on the floating body, tucked in the victim's jacket. After investigating other missing people, we had two other visual evidence of the island from different people. Another photograph from a journal, then another one drawn. Most of them were residents of these part of the city too. [PREGRINE:] It can be auditory, yes. At first we were unable to determine it properly, but well.. My friend here, he is a member of the CRISIS CREW that will accompany you search for the victims, he has actually heard the call vaguely upon arriving to this area. @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★ @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷 @lolocane 🥂 ophelia @Boochi 🌿 Magnolia & Mint @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine

Liu BOT 21-Dec-22 01:14 PM
"To me, not really. It was vague if anything, and.. Not exactly pleasant. Felt more like something whispered in my ear but I can't make out what it says, pointing to the direction of the lake, which is where you know. The Island is at." He looks to Pregrine before then to Eclaire and Hayden, who asked the next questions. "It feels like a voice but not exactly. It's like a thought that popped in my head, but i know it wasn't mine. And, no, I wasn't. But I knew something was wrong." And then he shrugs, "Eh, you know. I pass by this area a lot really. Lived nearby, but gettin' a new place soon, so a little tired. but nothin out of the ordinary really."
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 21-Dec-22 01:17 PM
Doris listens with keen ears to the answers to her fellow detectives questions. Very interesting how it seemed that victims were compelled to visit the island. “Are other residents were aware of this island outside of the victims who can see it, l-like any warnings to locals about avoiding it?” She’s assuming no, but it didn’t hurt to ask, “How recent were all the missing cases? Within the span of the last few months or longer?” @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

Liu BOT 21-Dec-22 01:35 PM
And it was a long pause, he was contemplating a moment, there was a situation indeed, but that was much longer than a few weeks ago. And he's more than hesitant to bring it up, but, should it bring forth some light into the mystery then, it'd be a crime not to mention. At least to him. "Weird isn't the word for it, but." Another pause, a short one as his brow furrows into a knit as he looked to the side, at nothing in particular. An expression that you can't quite make out, but he answers at least, this is at most that he would give to you right now. "I went to therapy after losing my fiancee. I still think about her." He turns back to look at Hayden. "So yeah, that's an. Unpleasant. part of my life, but that was a long while back. You think that has to do with anything? Detective.?"

◉ YOU SET OFF Armed with what weapon you could use to protect you and yours, and the knowledge that you can only hope was enough to help you solve the case, you ride the [BOAT] and casted away. It was a short journey, the [ISLAND] was not far off at all. #You could always see it when you look at the lake. The [CRISIS CREW] was also rather quiet, other than the ones who checked their equipment, but while this may be another job to you, this would be the first for many of [them]. After all, those who are here with you are also the only ones who can see the Island. Before your thought could wander further though, [YOU ARRIVE].- time: 08:35AM + location: THE DOCKS Forest - silent hill 2

sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena 21-Dec-22 02:48 PM
The island’s docks were almost a few decades older than the one you just left. The boat's crew commented on if the pier’s pillars were even sturdy enough to anchor at. Regardless, what choice was left? There was a job to be done. You do make note of the many, *many* [rental boats] either beached on the shore or tied to the pier. The pier’s deck sways ever so slightly as you step onto it. The heavy fog that blankets the area, keeping the cold waters beneath warm and those above its embrace freezing stretches out in all directions, leaving you with about [20 or so feet worth of visibility] and turning everything further back into vague shadowy shapes in the fog. The port itself was just a simple run down building with no one to greet you. The door to the hut itself isn’t locked but going in, only a set of broken radio equipment greets you. There are remnants of what looks to be posters or maps torn off the walls and the spattering of empty crumpled beer cans and bottles from a long while ago strewn across the floor. Beyond the hut was the road leading out of the docks and a [notice board].

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 21-Dec-22 03:10 PM
It is a bit eerie, seeing the abandoned rental boats at the dock. If the missing people's sojourn to the island was in doubt before, it certainly wasn't now. Maeron steps off the boat, glancing around. He has to wonder what this place was supposed to be before it was left to ruin, given that there clearly had to have been people here before to build this structure and put together any maps. Was there anything akin to an informational pamphlet about the island? @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 21-Dec-22 05:51 PM
She startles at the sound of pain and the slicing of flesh, immediately turning back to look at the groups direction. Oh Dear Lord God. She scrambled to get her first aid kit from her bag, kneeling need Bianca but trying to avoid the puddling liquid.
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 21-Dec-22 05:53 PM
Breath hitches back in her throat, registering pain, true pain, for the first time in a long time. She wasn't expecting it, only staring back at the creature with wide eyes. Her forearm hovers rigid in place, still, like the rest of her. But it's not anything she does that prompts the canine to release. It wasn't often the things she interacted with retaliated like that. Before having a chance to process the way this makes her feel, Bernette catches the glint of the other detective's sword, staring at that instead. That was quick. (edited)
Magnolia Faragher BOT 21-Dec-22 05:58 PM

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 21-Dec-22 05:58 PM
Eclaire steps aside, giving them space and letting Viray handle Bianca even though she wants to grip her shoulders and shake her violently on instinct She settles on a “Fuck’s sake,” hissed out, not at really the other detective, no, more directed to the fog. “Sorry,” she says, truly feeling no remorse. “I know you wanted to save it.” Her eyes snap to the ground, the pooling liquid, the trail… It’s good she didn’t just snap up Bianca like a sack of potatoes and rushed her into the building. They weren’t sure of its current state and facilities.
1
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 21-Dec-22 06:08 PM
“I should be able to,” Doris makes she to keep her kit fully stocked, and it helps that her mom is a nurse at the hospital and she’s gotten a lot of things for free. She grabs Bianca’s arm gently, careful of the fabric that clung to her skin from the bite. She pours saline solution into a clean cloths, wiping around the wound carefully before dabbing a bit of ointment before wrapping it up nicely. She’s a bit slow but methodical and precise with the bandage. “We have to be more cautious with these creatures, I think.” Her tone is not judgemental or reprimanding in the way Magnolia was, her voice was laced more with concern than anything else, “The way they bleed is definitely not normal, might be related to whatever anomaly is compelling the missing people into the island.”
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 21-Dec-22 06:20 PM
"It's fine," She offers Eclaire a cheerful smile. "You don't have to apologize." Bianca moves to stand, pausing only when her arm is grabbed. The flinch is subtle, settling easily enough while watching the methodical work Doris makes of the bite. "Oh wow, that's well done! Thank you, Doris." She wasn't expecting her senior to be quite so good with a first aid kit, it's a pleasant surprise. Bianca inspects the bandage before rising to her feet. Placing a boot against the canine's ribs, gloved hands grasp over the crowbar's handle as she tries to ease it out from the anomaly's corpse. (edited)

18:23
18:24
A little ways off from the main abandoned town stood a fairly tall run down building. It’s only tall compared to the single or double storey shop houses of the town’s high street but the hospital stood a mere [3 storeys], quite miserly compared to the super complexes of modern Meteor City hospitals. A large sign just a little off from the building’s entrance reads [“Alchemilla Hospital”] with a caduceus symbol to hammer in that this is *indeed* the hospital. The structure itself doesn’t seem to be too worse for wear, at least if you had to huddle somewhere for warmth, the building looked warmer than the foggy outside of the island. True - Silent Hill 2

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 03:00 PM
It’s normal and human to react that way to seeing someone in a clearly anomalous area appear with a sword, but all their efforts of remaining quiet have now been dashed. When he screams she jolts slightly; the sound ringing in her ears after eerie silence and hushed voices. She instinctively tries to get in between the nurses and the other detectives, though that futile attempt was unnecessary for they were not the current target. The thumping upstairs… Too much noise! Again, his continued scream was only human as the three monstrous nurses assailed him. She follows and swings her blade at the nearest one while hoping that the length of the weapon would keep them relatively at bay. These things had weapons of their own too—the man’s screaming an indication that he was still conscious. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena 22-Dec-22 03:02 PM

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 03:10 PM
Bianca's eyes widen - watching events unfold, between the trucker's screams and the three 'nurses' redirecting their attention on him. It's not out of fear, though. Not at all. Maybe this island was worth something, after all. She watches the stranger's assault, grip on the firearm within her bag tightening. But if she used it, who could say that more of those things wouldn't show up? Senior detective Bellam seemed more than capable. And why should she stick her neck out for someone she doesn't know? Bianca hangs back, watching for movement behind and in front of the group. His screams were bound to attract something.

The itch to turn and run away crawls through her skin but she can’t. She won’t do that. They were supposed to stick together. She grips tightly to the baton in her hand at the ready.

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 03:45 PM
It has always been a weakness of hers. One that co-exists with--no, is actively fueled by--her fiery temper. There are times you wait and see, and there are times that you must act. Quick decisions, whether they prove fatal or not, are part of being a fighter. So she is compelled to strike. Better her chances than that of an unarmed civilian. Isn't that what she was made for? She's aware she's outnumbered. She has no data on these opponents. She may pay the price. I will pay the price, she recognises in the split second she lunged. But at the prospect of being useful? It matters not. STR 10 @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 04:20 PM
Fate is simply not on her side today. She knows the motions. She's practiced it over and over before: schnitt. Take down your opponent, use your off hand to grab the sword to cut away. But she's outnumbered, and that requires showing her back to the remaining two. And she did not have her gauntlets on to protect the hand that would force the blade. The choice isn't easy. Her teeth are bared without her noticing, feeling pure venom at the only logical decision to make. She abandons the sword. Steps back-- And immediately regrets it when the trucker goes silent. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena 22-Dec-22 04:27 PM
You throw away the one thing that has been keeping you safe. #The symbol of your knighthood. Now you were no different from the peasants in the streets. The nurse with the sword lodged in her slumps down, you watch as [rust snakes up your precious sword] at an alarming rate. Decaying before your very eyes. As the nurse falls, the [large pipe] she had been holding skids to your feet. A man was killed by the very coworker you protected earlier. #Et tu, Brute? @tryphmas tree ⚔ eclaire
4
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 04:28 PM
Something isn't right. She's done this before, a million times, if she bothered to count. Firearm training was one of the first things her father taught her when she was old enough. She knew how to hold it. She knew how the recoil would rock her body, it came second nature. The last thing she was ever expecting was to miss. And it's less about the consequences of that misfire that frustrates her. How could she miss? Was she truly that out of practice? Her bandaged arm throbs, and Bianca's expression grows cold. There's no time to check for a pulse. If anything, silence confirms it. It doesn't matter. She didn't know him. If he valued his life, he wouldn't have come here in the first place. With a low hiss, she clicks the safety back in place, puts the firearm away and snatches back the crowbar instead. The gunshot was loud enough. Hopefully it would be just the thing to redirect the nurses' attention - but just for good measure, she smashes the instrument against the closest wall, once, twice, three times. If her aim wasn't good enough, she'd find different way to make ends meet. Look at me. (edited)
sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena 22-Dec-22 04:41 PM
The remaining nurses look up. This was the first time you got to see them for what they truly were unhindered by the heat and panick of tormented screams. For a second when the silence began, the stood eerily still. Like manequins almost, posed in a snapshot since the last they heard anything. And when they started to move, they move so unnaturally, like a glitch in the system, joins moving how they should not. And they [look at you Bianca,] they look at you, heads bandaged up. No eyes, no mouth, [no face]. [ ROLL DEX TO INTERVINE OR DODGE, STR TO ATTACK, CON TO TAKE THE BLOW ] @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8) @tryphmas tree ⚔ eclaire
3
Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 04:54 PM
It stings as if it were her arm. And it was, in a sense. A knight's weapons are extensions of themselves, and she had basically lost a limb. More importantly, despite her penchant for collecting them each one was special to her. Each one crafted carefully by blacksmiths still practicing and improving the art. She wants nothing more than to tear them apart. But how can you, with a simple baton against anomalies? Her eyes sting from the ugly emotion, but by sheer force it doesn't fully form tears. Four swords she brought to Meteor City, and now it's down one. This one, like a few other blades back at home, was her father's graduation gift to her. Yet it still feels silly to want to cry over a blade right now. Why am I mourning metal over a human life? Was it more knightly? Less? Mourning your extension, a part of you. Or mourning a life, them being a stranger be damned, don't you have a duty to protect those who cannot fight? She foolishly forgets (unsure if the red flash she saw was her own hair or blind rage) about the baton, and tries to tackle one of the nurses away from her coworker. No one else has to die tonight. Not while she's still standing. (She sure has forgotten herself in that equation.) STR Critical Failure 1 @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
6
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 04:58 PM
It's working. It's working. Something flickers past the sheet of ice that consumes Bianca's gaze. An unbridled delight, to have the attention of something not quite right on her. She's felt this before. It's why she kept going into places she shouldn't. It's why she lived without considering consequences. Steel clangs against the wall again as she turns on her heel, the detective runs, dragging the bloodied weapon behind her to make as much of a racket as possible. (DEX 14) "Over here! This way!" Bianca shouts, trying to distract the two remaining nurses away from Eclaire, and whatever else lurked nearby.

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 05:21 PM
Ugh. This office was full of heroes, wasn't it? She would've thought Eclaire to have enough sense to know exactly what Bianca was trying to achieve, but no. She goes ahead and tackles one of the anomalies, gets herself hurt in the process. Bianca could leave her behind. Why not? It's just what her other two coworkers did. Including ever so sweet, beloved Doris. So why couldn't she? It was only fair. But two bodies was harder to explain away than one. Especially if one such corpse was that of your coworker. Truth be told, Eclaire was of more use to Bianca alive than dead, at least for the time being. Someone steadfast, strong, with a sense for justice and protection. She could be so useful, if she only had a leash. Bianca leans into the dodge, making use of her small frame to use the crowbar to try knocking out the legs of the closest nurse.

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:29 PM
The pain is explosive. Normally, her mind would be supplying her some valuable information. Like how if this cut goes deep enough to tear the muscle fibres, she could lose usage of her entire leg. Of injuries she's heard of and seen in the HEMA community that were devastating. Or how she'll start bleeding out soon. If she wasn't already. It's a bone saw, so it shouldn't act as a plug. She was probably bleeding profusely already. She cannot feel it. Oh well. Instead, it feels like a haze, like the fog was in her, then snap! Clarity so excruciating. The hyperawareness of adrenaline and blood pumping in her veins. The rapid tempo of her heart. It almost makes her stupid. (Or maybe she was already with all her bad decisions.) "I didn't sign the surgery waiver," she blurts out, as if she were joking with the lads. Unsure what it was at this point. Hoping she hasn't lost it. I wonder what kind of cake papa will bake for Christmas this year...? One hand grabs at the saw's handle, trying to wrestle the damn thing off of her, while the other forcefully grabs at the nurses' hands. Trying to rip it off the handle. I hope it's strawberry shortcake this year. My favourite. She knows the fear will grip her soon. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 06:07 PM
"Haha... ha ha ha!" She rights herself, tosses the head with no regard to the side, and let's another haaa out. Relief. Thrill. There is no other time she feels more alive than in fights. Though she only has blood and one rusty sword to show for it. Speaking of, is it still here? She watches the crowbar slam repeatedly until the beast is motionless. Inelegant. But impressive all the same. Eclaire has always appreciated fighting spirit. "Did you--" enjoy it? She stops herself. Belatedly realising she still had a wicked adrenaline induced grin on her face. The question wasn't meant to provoke or judge. A question to ask your fellow warrior in honest interest. "Are you unharmed?" Her own injuries be damned. Eclaire asks Bianca instead, face reigned back into a too-carefully-constructed neutral. Which expression was more unsettling to the other? Eclaire hopes this was more comforting. @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8) @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 06:34 PM
"You ask for forgiveness too much," She notes, her voice dry. Bianca rifles through her bag, retrieving the gun. They only needed somewhere tucked away to get their bearings back. Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 06:37 PM
"Do I?" she almost seems amused. She'd rather like to call it accountability or something else. She fiddles a bit with the saw, unsure what sort of stance to take. It's not really made to be a weapon. But it'll do more damage than the baton. "I have other swords." She answers evasively.
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 06:40 PM
"Yes, but you seemed particularly upset about the state of that one before it broke." With a sigh, Bianca turns. "Sit down, please. Let me see your leg."
Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 06:42 PM
Eclaire doesn't reply to that. She sits and stretches the leg out obediently in silence.
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 06:56 PM
Her silence speaks volumes. "Keep an ear out," Bianca mumbles, searching through her bag with a disappointed click of her tongue. Of all days to forget the first aid kit, she'd need get creative. There's extra scarves in here - and it doesn't really matter if they get dirty, the rest of her clothes were ruined anyway. At least they're clean. She crouches beside Eclaire, mumbling a quiet sorry before trying to rip more of the fabric loose around her thigh, to see the cut better. "This might hurt a bit," is the only warning given before Bianca pulls one scarf over the thigh, the other beneath it. Pressing a knee to the wound, she uses both to tie a tight surgeons knot, leaving it compact and covered. "We can clean and stitch it properly with Doris' first aid kit," Bianca mutters, less than pleased with the realization. "You won't bleed out, if they bother to come back." @tryphmas tree ⚔ eclaire
Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 07:05 PM
She nods every now and then to confirm she's listening, her face lowered a bit. She wonders why Bianca mumbles a sorry, as if it could be more painful than the wound itself. As if she even cared at all? Aside from needing a meat-shield, she muses as she scrutinises the other detective through her lashes. which is a good reason, admittedly. And not to forget the paper work they'd have to do. Her gaze drops to Bianca's ministrations, then darting left and right in vigilance. "You rather we wait than go upstairs ourselves?" She absently wonders if she's being a nuisance to the other, not really caring what the answer was at the moment. @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8)
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 22-Dec-22 07:11 PM
"Do you want to go upstairs?" Her gaze flits upwards, half-lidded. She didn't want to. She'd be perfectly content never seeing Magnolia or Doris again. Maybe they both died. Who knows - wasn't her business. They left. She doesn't care. @tryphmas tree ⚔ eclaire

Stepping out of the way was child's play. What she hadn't ever anticipated was Doris stepping directly into the cleaver's path. Bianca stands, motionless, as the elevator begins its descent. Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 22-Dec-22 09:38 PM
She releases a sharp cry of pain as the blade cuts through her shoulder, this cut was deeper and far more painful than any she’d experienced before. She slumps against the closed doors, shaky hand clasping at the bleeding wound . “I-i-is it really playing martyr if I’m s-a-still alive?” She mumbles, lightheaded from shock and the pain. She takes a shallow breaths, wincing. She wants to wipe the tears in her eyes away but it would probably be best not to move, not yet. She closes eye eyes tight, letting the tears of pain gather then fall. “I… couldn’t let that… hit you. I…” her mumble grows faint, “I did promise to have your back.” And she didn’t break promises. @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8)

As the group makes its trek towards the church, Bianca's gaze flickers back to the hospital in the distance, almost longing. She wished she couldve spent more time there, but the siren along with everything else indicated it was time to go. Maybe later.

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 12:00 AM

Asteria Galanis (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:03 AM

Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 23-Dec-22 12:29 AM
Doris closed her eyes as Asteria patched up the cut, swallowing down any cries of pain, trying to keep deep and steady breaths with each pull of the string against her skin. A blur of thoughts rush through her mind, intangible and fleeting. Trying to decipher them felt far more taxing than to focus solely on the physical sensations, or perhaps she just didn’t want to, not yet at least. But she knew this; she would do it again, for any of them. “Thank you,” she whispers once it’s done. She only opens her eyes again once the elevator comes to a stop, feeling a little light headed from the blood loss, needing to lean against the wall for an extra moment longer before getting up and following them out of the basement and back outdoors. Doris stops in her steps when she hears the sound of Peregrines voice through the static on the Walkie. Church. The blur of thoughts she had ignored finally coalesce and sharpen; thoughts of previous cases related to churches and angels coming to mind. She didn’t know all the details of what happened in some of them, but she was smart enough to put the pieces of what she heard first hand and what she read on paper together. It was usually never pretty. Goosebumps form across her arm as she sees the cracks in the road and the withering trees, feeling a throb of pain flare up. She could do this, we’re all going to through this. She doesn’t realize she’s muttered it aloud like a mantra as picked up the pace, as much as she can in her wounded state at least. “Wedding .. ring? May… maybe it’s in… the church…”
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 12:36 AM
"Is it?" She blinks. "A wedding ring."
Asteria Galanis (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:42 AM

They had left it on the boat by the shore for a reason. They didn't think there was a chance they'd be escorted back.

Asteria Galanis (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 05:41 AM
"..." She feels dejected seeing Bianca so easily give up on pushing but she also understood she was being difficult. In many ways, it felt like a normally everyday conversation with her own step-daughter. How is she fairing? How is her wife fairing? They must be worried sick. But they really shouldn't be. Asteria wasn't worth their time... The weight of the vial who's contents were drained, used on the person she had shown mercy to earlier, weighed heavy in her pocket. The contents that were meant for herself, used for a benevolent(?) purpose. If only their places were switched, maybe she wouldn't be saddled with even more guilt than she already was forced to bear. It felt like Atlas was shouldering more than just his own world now. Maybe she didn't leave the hospital the same. Maybe she left even worse. Ah, has the fog on this island always been this hard to see through?

You four continued to walk, you reach the [TOWN] by now. You can leave the stragglers to them you're sure. So further down the empty roads you went, to what might as well be a [GHOST TOWN]. Maeron Al Najjar BOT 21-Dec-22 04:23 PM
Empty streets, the forgotten vestiges of the past. It was all at once foreign and familiar: a scenery he had never come across, yet seemed to know all the same. And then, for a moment, he thinks he might have seen something actually familiar, and it arrests his movement-- only for a second, barely a breath-- before he continues walking, countenance going stony. Stupid anomaly house. Stupid anomaly island. He hadn't let anomalies get to him before, and he wasn't about to start now.

Peregrine (any) BOT 21-Dec-22 04:27 PM
They keep a wary eye out as they move along with their little group, one hand resting on the camera in their jacket pocket and the other keeping a grip on their baton. For just a split second, they think they see something out of the corner of their eye, turning their gaze to look. But it's already gone. Maybe it was part of this anomaly, or maybe it was one of the crisis team members. They don't care to investigate it either way. They planned to be on their toes, but they weren't one to let paranoia get the best of them either. Best to just move on. They try not to stray too far from anyone, but is there anything of note with any of the buildings? Stray flyers, posters, wayward items from missing persons? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 21-Dec-22 04:30 PM
Hypervigilant as he was, the fog put Frankie on edge. It's a bit strange, he thinks, that the four of them are basically sitting ducks in the vulnerable fog and yet nothing has happened. He thinks he heard Maeron hitch his breath though Frankie only thinks and dares not assume. He looks back, for a slight moment, attempting to make out the other's expression through the dense fog. "Strange, isn't it, no evidence of life or what was once lived in." Frankie comments mindlessly, trying to fill the dead air. "Creepy... Yeah.... nothing at all like the town I grew up in, despite both being, well, towns.." He walks up closer to the group, "We should stick together. We don't know when the fog might take another person." @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine @pugmas ✦ miette @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 12:42 PM
This was once a warm and welcoming stay, if Frankie closed his eyes, he could imagine another life where this town was lively again and people laughed in this motel, a man smoking cigarettes on the balcony maybe and a woman leaning on the counter, she's having a casual conversation with the old desk lady. There's pastries on the receptionist desk, freshly baked, sent in by the neighbours every morning. Of course, all of that doesn't exist now. There was a motel in his hometown too, similarly quaint and small, Frankie reminisces. He'd draw himself towards the jukebox, wondering if it still played, but Maeron beat him to it and the other didn't appear to be in the best of moods, considering the sudden kick so he goes to the pool table instead. "Reckon anyone up for a game of pool?" He murmurs to no one in particular, picking a pool stick up and examining it, traces of chalk dust still remaining. He looks under the pool table and in the pockets of the table, does he notice anything or find the pool balls? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 01:47 PM
"Huh, really? That's foreboding," they hum to Miette, though taking note of the name. M. D'Angelo... Probably one of the recent disappearances, if they had to guess. Their head tips to the side, eyes drifting up to the ceiling for a moment. Maybe their guest was upstairs. They weren't sure what they expected to find in the drawer, but an etching like this? Their fingers absentmindedly trace the shape. "Yoohoooo... I see you too~" They whisper to it, and no one else in particular. They did not mind judgmental stares. They knew what who they were. Still, they draw their hand away and shut the drawer, allowing it to return to darkness. Nothing else to find there. Their head perks up at the sound of music, brows raising towards Maeron. "Oh huh! Didn't think that old thing would work. It's a nice song." They sway to it, combing their eyes around the rest of the room. They couldn't decide if the music made the atmosphere better or worse, or maybe just different? As they mull over it, their gaze lands on the hallway to the dining area. Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 01:54 PM
"I think the fog must be getting to me. That, or the thin winter air." Frankie whispers, hands gripping the pool stick until his knuckles turned white. Good thing he wasn't holding Peregrine's hand after all. He's not talking to anyone, never really was, maybe it was meant to be heard to the shadow that doesn't exist anymore-- so basically no one. He's snapped out of his wallowing thoughts when static-like music plays from the jukebox, old stereo still having it in him. With a sigh, he looks one last time under the pool table, and picks up the white pool. Maybe it's a lucky sign that there's still all the balls here. This is the part where he finds a magic 8-ball and all the answers come to Frankie when he shakes it. Hahahh. "Looks like it's still playable." Frankie gathers the balls and arranges them in the triangle fashion. This was probably not worth anything, but it wouldn't hurt. With a careful hand, he plays pool for one turn, positioning the stick to eye level with the white ball, and with a stark, cold, clack he fires it against the tip of the triangle, watching the balls scatter. It wasn't really all that cathartic, but he used to play it with his grandparents, sometimes, [her] too. His eyes sweep to the stairs, are they safe to climb? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 01:57 PM

MIETTE (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 01:57 PM

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 22-Dec-22 01:58 PM
He was beginning to learn that his inclination to approach things as usual-- as though they were normal had him sorely unprepared for the unexpected. While he was not unfamiliar with anomalies, Maeron had only ever encountered the more tangible ones: the kinds that you could track, catch, and keep. This was something else entirely. Something he really didn't fucking like. Of course, it could have also just been any old jukebox, worn down and a bit broken. There was no reason to read too much into the song it randomly chose to play. No reason at all. "I guess." His response to Peregrines comment is absentminded and unfocused. He's staring daggers at the machine, willing it to turn off. "It was never my thing." Maeron presses his eyes closed, jaw clenched and muscle flexing. He couldn't afford to get distracted and think about it right now anyways. He would accept the open invitation for pool if this wasn't a time sensitive engagement. Maeron sharply withdraws from the jukebox, silently cursing it for the needless commotion, and begins heading up the stairs himself. @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:01 PM
For a ghost, or anomaly, or maybe his own delusions (not surprising), it sure felt warm for a moment. It would have been a mercy had the presence ran his blood cold instead, it shouldn't hurt but it does. Holding his breath he ascends the stairs, expecting any moment now to lose his footing and fall through but as far as things went, Frankie makes it up the flight safely. What does he see up the stairs? or rather, doesn't see. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 02:05 PM

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:10 PM

For someone so focused on his surroundings he was pretty terrible at being aware of actually living humans-- one whose name started with M, in his vicinity, huh. "Sorry," he mutters. The hallway a symmetrical creation, doors leading far into the distance. Frankie decides he doesn't like this subliminal feeling. "It would be faster for you to take the left rooms, and I'll take the right." He announces, though he nearly says it would be safer to go together instead, frowning. Don't be a liability, it's just a motel, the faster you're done with your job and out of here, the safer everyone will be, he tells himself. @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★
Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:19 PM
They take quick stock of the dining room, a mental note for later. They hoped it would not come into use, but it was important to know where facilities lie in case of an emergency. Quietly, they take one of the knives, slipping it into their little sidebag. Nothing too large, but just in case. Something more worth wielding than a baton. They're quick to rejoin the group, trotting back in just to see them crowding the stairs with Maeron taking the lead. They can't help but roll their eyes a little. Of course. Last time they watched him ascend a staircase, they tried to lend some helpful advice, and instead got to deal with a hysterical ghost from his hand. They nod to Frankie, offering him a smile. "How about you take the first right room, and I'll take the second, okay~? Right beside you." They don't really wait for his answer, moving to open the door to the second room on the right. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:34 PM
Twos a pair, and three's a party. "Are you sure? We could go together for safety since we don't know if there's any friendly faces in those rooms yet--" his sentence starts dying in his mouth as his roommate disappears into the room without waiting. With a sigh and slumped shoulders, he takes the first room to the right, knocking, for some reason. Screw it why was he knocking, he's going to be a man! And turn the doorknob... like a man! A manlier man would probably kick the door down but the motel was kind of lovely when not... creepy, so Frankie feels like that would be a waste... "Anyone there? Excuse me..." @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:35 PM
Seeing the rest take initiative, Miette tucks the guestbook into her coat and steels her nerves (again) as she quickly climbs the stairs— though she comes to a slow pause at the top... it's still quiet, isn't it? Barring the creak of the stairs and their own voices. She stops herself from asking more questions. Take things as they are— isn't that what she usually does when anomalies aren't involved? "If you wanna open that one," she gives Maeron a light tap on the shoulder as she brushes past him this time, pointing to the first room on the left, while she moves to the second room on the left. @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★ @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Maeron Al Najjar BOT 22-Dec-22 02:42 PM
Compared to the eeriness of the jukebox, the hallway is a bit underwhelming. But all things considering, underwhelming is a comfort. Maeron doesn't really take kindly to being told what to do. He nods in acknowledgement and acknowledgement alone as his coworkers kindly suggest which door he should investigate. But as soon as they've retreated into their respective rooms, Maeron heads for the door at the end of the hall, opening that one instead. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

15:03
◉ ROOM 203: THE RED ROOM
cw: blood, gore, viscera
[PEREGRINE] you take the handle of the second door on the right hall, even before you open the door your nose smelled a horribly thick scent [IRON] once more, you smelled it once before, when the [BANG] of a bullet was shot to the poor wounded horse your father had to put down. The hairs on your neck stood, an eerie chill that made you hesitate for a second, nervous even. #A feeling that felt like it was forcibly placed upon you. The door wasn’t locked, and you could easily open the door in full. And you see.. [A ROOM][Painted solely, complete, entirely.. IN RED]As if it was all washed in a [CRASHING WAVE] of #BLOOD. No. Not” as if” the red and the pool that leaked to the soles of your shoes was blood. You’ve seen it before. #Once from the poor horse your father shot #Then from the bird you crushed with your mercy Here too something, or [SOMEONE] was crushed. You see in the center of the room was the gruesome, bloodied [REMAINS] of a once human’s viscera. Bloodied flesh, broken teeth and bones. Crushed by the weight of something #Heavy Around the room, though, small patches of the walls unpainted in red was white food, pictures hung all over. [FAMILY PHOTOS] you think. @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine (edited)
Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 03:19 PM
She becomes completely still as the door swings open, staring dead ahead into the bloodied room. How does she even react to this? How is she supposed to? The smell fills up their nostrils, sits heavy on their tongue. They look down at the floor, idly lifting and pressing their feet into the tacky, sticky liquid beneath them. It's disgustingly familiar. They had long since grown to it; you have to, growing up as they did. Putting down lame horses, shooting at coyotes, cleaning up the gored remains of a chicken who fled too far from the coop. Of all the times they cut and bruised and scraped their body, always too rough, always too loud, always ready to get hurt for what needed to be done. The nervousness certainly does not feel like their own. They let a low whistle under their breath, but make no move to otherwise indicate their colleagues of the utter mess they stand in front of right now. Perhaps best kept to herself. They want to investigate, certainly, but they're not stupid. They dig through their bag, looking for something small, expendable while their eyes stare up at the ceiling. Is there blood there? Their fingers clasp around a small thing of lipbalm. They won't need this. Pulling it out, they toss it into the middle of the room to see if there's any sort of reaction. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 03:23 PM
◉ ROOM 201: THE BURNING ROOM [FRANKIE] You take the handle of the door with intention to push it open, unveil what mystery that laid in this room. But your hand immediately feels the [SEARING PAIN] of [BURNING METAL] at the touch. Though you’ve yet to turn the knob, it opens anyway…- DO YOU PEER INTO THE ROOM? --- Silly Fran, You have no choice but to look, if given a choice, you’d just run right?You immediately feel the gust of [HOT WIND] from the inside, the [CRACKLE OF FLAMES], as if you’ve opened the gateway to hell itself. [FLAMES BURN] brightly, viciously, #mercilessly. Though it was clear, the room was engulfed in a [SEA OF FLAMES], the fire does not seem to move past the borders of the door. But you smell a [TERRIBLE STENCH] like burnt meat you’ve left in the oven. Beyond the endless blaze was the silhouette of a #burning man. Body charcoaled from the hungry flames, angered from whatever sins he’s committed. [Fire burns many things, Frankie.] Wood Flesh Life #... Bridges. How many did [you] burn from your cowardice? #All the steps you could have taken but never did. #All the things you could have said but chose to hide. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie

◉ ROOM 202: THE SHOW GALLERY
CW: Gore, blood, violence, blood
[MAERON] you open the door, annoyed by what little antics this anomaly has done so far. The back door was locked leaving you to have to listen to your coworkers and open the door on the left. So open it you do. The room was [DARK] at first, and before you could do much else, [SPOTLIGHTS] began to flicker to life one after another in a line. The centermost one was the largest one, showing you the [CENTREPIECE] of what should have been an art exhibit. [hung by strings from the top of the ceiling] [hands, legs, skin, skull, and at the center, framed by the blooming ribs was..][A HUMAN HEART]No longer beating, of course. An art piece consisting of the bloody remains of a woman. No doubt, one of the missing people you think. Still, you couldn’t look away.Do you know? How it feels? To be a [THING] that is seen, used and existed only for the purpose of people who know nothing about you. Who doesn’t care about you? Believing you do this for [YOU] when you aren’t. Hung and moved like puppets on a string. How many lives have you ruined, people you’ve hurt, all because you were a puppet in a stranger’s hand.A sinking feeling at your chest grows, as if someone gouged out your torso and hollowed out your ribs. #You feel sick to the stomach. @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 03:57 PM
tw: bile, panic attack, slight gore descriptions Scorched metal, cold to the touch, flares up again burning away at his fingernails his flesh his blood, welded to the knob that turns. An illusion. That's all that is. All it is. Though what he sees in front of him isn't an illusion. At least, that's what his senses tell him. Real, so very real, the rotting corpse mixed with char and ash, silhouette almost unrecognizable in the crackling, blackened walls. Frankie Mane sees a man, a dead, dead man. A man that should have been him. Burnt far too many bridges yet not once has he managed to set himself on fire. Was it because he was loved? That he was lucky? That fortune favors the cowardly? Fuck. Fuck. If he closes his eyes, he can still smell it. the lingering ash, blown gently by the his breath. [still alive] In an otherwise, dead, dead town. Frankie can't breathe. As if there isn't enough air in the atmosphere for even his tiny lungs to heave. He doubles over, and retches, acid burning in his throat. Eyes bulging out of its sockets as if this once-frail, once-small frame couldn't hold all the nausea inside. This is the part where he realizes how much of a mistake it was to join this detective company, Frankie never was the bigger man, and was foolish to think he could change that he could run away or even face (not even the fire, but) the embers and ashes. He croaks weakly, then laughs, then chokes on the ashes in the air. Laughter tasted like acid too. He's speaking to a dead man. "I need to get out of here." Burn more bridges, possibly. Kneeling on the floor, Frankie sifts through the ashes, through the charred body, is there anything left on the person?

◉ ROOM 204: THE GARDEN TABLE CW: Body horror, trypophobia [MIETTE] before you even open the door you could smell a surprisingly lovely scent from the inside. Floral? Hoping for a room that may not be horrifying for you. I mean, it smelled nice, so it couldn’t be all that bad right? #You hope, You Pray. Even if you aren’t much of a believer. The door opens easily, and you feel a gentle breeze as a petal of a red rose blew into your face. The scent was even stronger here, thick with flowers, the floor beneath even felt a little grassy. But the view in front of you was in fact. [Not as Pleasant] as you so desperately wished.[DEATH AND FLOWERS COME HAND IN HAND DON’T THEY?]A long dining table is placed within the room, many chairs line the side, except for the single chair throned at the end. On the smaller chairs laid [PLANTS], shrubbery made to shape like [HUMANS], beautiful blooming flowers burst from where their heads should be. Each of them made to emote with one another, mimicking humanity’s social circles, speaking, #gossipping. The one at the very end, though, was most definitely [HUMAN]. Dead, you’re sure from her lifeless eyes, dried remains of tears taint her cheeks. Her head cracked backwards, mouth forced open much farther than yours should be able to. A [BOUQUET] of flowers bloomed from her mouth from what you can imagine coming from her throat. From her skin too grew sprouts, and smaller flowers. A girl, forced to become what she is [NOT], to become those she was never meant to [BE], and paid the price for it.[You wonder if she regrets it.] [A Guilt that tore her from inside out.] [To follow what other pressures you to be until you twist into something you’re not] [Doesn’t it hurt?][You know, don’t you Miette?] @pugmas ✦ miette

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 22-Dec-22 04:18 PM
It's numbing, mostly. To see a person strung up like this. A person whom Maeron had never known, never cared for, and had sought to find out of a commitment to seeing this job through to its intended end. Not because he held and sympathy for the missing persons. He held no sympathy, but... There is the faintest echo of a memory, colors washed out by time and details drowned in alcohol. The first time he had ever seen blood on his hands. The first time he had ever seen blood flowing from someone else. The series of times thereafter of broken bones (sometimes his, sometimes not) and lacerated flesh (a long time commonality in much of his more professional exchanges.) Experiences that altered his perceptions-- him, entirely-- and washed the world in a bleak filter. Maeron had always thought himself the type of person who could see the world for what it was, and it as this: a body broken and taken apart, every fiber exposed and vulnerable, beloved more for its memories, its past, what it used to mean, rather than its present conditions. No one loved the body that was without its vitality, held together by something outside of itself. No one loved a heart that was no longer beating. No one could love a body that never belonged to the person inside of it. Only the fantasies it could gratify before the rot set in to disenchant the dream. He breathes in. Breathes out. Ignores the emotional detritus trying to create an obstacle to clear thought. He steps fully into the room, gaze sliding away from another victim of the world's selfishness. Instead, Maeron glances around the room, its spotlights. Was there anything else besides the centerpiece? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 04:21 PM

Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 04:29 PM
They wait, and wait, and wait. Nothing happens. They remain wary, but carefully, step by step, they enter the room. They can hear Frankie's retching in the room over, but quietly, they think to themself: He can handle it. He needs to learn to be strong. It's for his own good. They approach the splattered remains first, staring down at it with a rather blank expression. They hoped it didn't hurt too terribly. A crush of this force must've at least been a swift death. Crouching down, they stick their gloved hand into the viscera, sifting through it for anything of note. Any key items, any identifiers, any mementos. If nothing else, they collect what broken teeth they can. Not for themself, but perhaps for a dental record identification. If not that, then at least for a grieving family to have something to bury and mourn. It was the least they could do. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

7
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 04:45 PM
Perhaps the anomaly wanted him to see this picture. There was no other reason he could understand where it would have been kept intact. With a bitter taste Frankie can't help but agree with the sentiment. People drift apart, humans are frail, and peace, contentment, and the belief of stability are ever more so. However memories stay. At the end of the line, they are all that's left. Frankie would put this man out of his misery if he knew how. He puts the note down gently and stares, "You're not sorry." "There's nothing sorry about fire." Fire is angry, merciless, indiscriminately burning and licking until there is no more oxygen left for the both of them. Fire is anger. "You're frustrated at yourself. Angry at yourself that you weren't a better man." Fire doesn't know 'enough' and it doesn't know when to settle until it's all over. Between this dying father's words and the picture of happiness emanating from the photo, a memory preserved (all that is left of this man), Frankie tells the man, "You did your best." Somehow, those words calmed him more than they could calm a man on the brink of death. Words he wonders if he wanted to hear, for himself. Coming here, Frankie saw no smoke for a newly burnt victim, meaning it could be another vision from the anomaly, however the thick fog made it difficult to tell. And so, he would never know. Because dead men tell no lies but no truths either. Frankie observes the room one last time, trying to gather himself together and his courage too. Tell him, anomaly, is there anything else in the room you would like him to see?

santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 04:52 PM
[A NOVEL] whose book has closed, and you could no longer find the chapters that's filled its pages with the story. Was this place a haven for those to cry forever for what they couldn't have done? Or a place that would give the a false hope of repentance? Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 04:56 PM
Despite their brutish nature, they hold the bracelet delicately over their fingers, a thumb gently wiping away the blood and rolling over the beads. They remember a time when they made something similar, stringing together beads into shitty jewelry and smearing paint on thick paper in an attempt to make art. Childhood was always simpler, wasn't it? They missed their mom. They should call her soon. Tell her they loved her and wish her a merry Christmas. The sins of the father weigh on the son, or so they say. He never opened his heart to them, so they would never know the regrets he kept inside or when the love for them died. Sometimes they wish they could've cracked open his ribcage and fixed his heart themself, try as they might to save him from that crushing despair. He broke under that weight, but he was rebuilding piece by piece now. Mended things are always made stronger, right? But of course, they don't think they could ever look at him quite the same. [0;2m[0;2m[1;2m[0;2m[0;2m[0m[0m[0m[0m[0m[1;2m[1;2m[1;30mI was still here. I still needed you. Why couldn't you see?[0m[0m[0m[1;2m[0m Weight is all they ever knew now, all they ever carried. They would break their back to hold up the world if it made things right, made things better. They learned that much. So they won't break, not until they see another day, not until it matters. Carefully, they pocket the teeth and bracelet into a little baggy, with which they safely put into their bag. Standing to their feet, they move their attention over to the family photos. They pick up the one that had fallen to the ground, looking over it and then the other ones remaining on the walls. Are they of the same people? Is there anything to note? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

MIETTE (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:00 PM
cws for body horror thoughts? not sure but just in case, Even here, she's not free from the flowers, is she? It's not that they're bad— frightening as this place has been, Miette's worries are, for a moment, simpler things. Hayfever. Allergies. Faeries stealing things, hiding in flower fields growing in the middle of winter, and making her share embarrassing stories from when she was, 'like, twelve or something'. It wasn't horrible, though. Not like this is. Standing in this room, every part of her starts to feel wrong. Like she's not shaped the right way. It creeps over her slow and in parts; she sees the girl first, and the sight makes her own skin crawl, like there's something sprouting underneath it, every freckle a place for flowers to bloom. The shrubbery makes her want to brush down her hair, too wild, like it'll curl into flowers of its own and take her face with it. There's a lump forming in her throat. She's scared that it's going to start growing, and she'd just let it happen. She can't help it. She pulls off a glove, frustration pricking tears in her eyes for a moment as her fingers fumble, then her free hand slips under her sleeve. She screws her eyes shut, takes a breath, and— "...haha," Laughs? It's a very weak laugh, more an exhale than an actual sound, and she's not even smiling. "Ohhhh, god... what the fuck are you...?" But it's the only thing keeping her from freaking out entirely. Her nails scratch lightly over her skin as she takes slow steps over the grass. She looks over the shoulders of the seated shrubbery— is there anything else on the table? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

[PEREGRINE] You look at the family photos, there are so much of them, many had be sprayed by blood, drenched in the red that was once a mother. It's all mostly the same person, the same [WOMAN], found in every picture. her family photos, once a complete family of five, her, a husband, 2 daughters and a son. This room tells the story of this woman in particular, you realized. And though she's [LOST HER LIFE], you can feel her regret, her wish to have done better. [She loved her family]. [MIETTE] You laugh, a reaction to cope with all of this, a desperate attempt not to stop yourself from going completely undone. You take slow steps, the grass crunch beneath your feet. At the center of the table was a plate, on it, was a [PHOTOGRAPH] of another [GIRL], not the one who died here, red marker written on it [SORRY. 3
Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:23 PM
It wasn't hard to put the pieces of this puzzle together. Their head tips to the side as they examine the photos, feeling a small tug at their chest. They wondered what it would've been like to have had a sibling they were close to. They wondered what it would've have been like to move through a home that felt like a family, that didn't feel so empty. It didn't matter now. The past was the past, and they would march forward. At the very least, they're glad their mother left before she became crushed by this weight, too. They look around the room, idly rubbing their fingers together, sticky with blood even through the fabric. There's nothing left here for them to find, to tear apart, they suppose. Slowly, they trudge back towards the door, imprints of their shoes left in the blood. The trail would follow them out and onto the carpet, they're sure. Before they exit, they take one last stock to see if there's anything else needed to be found, needed to be seen. It's habitual at this point as they draw out their camera, taking a snapshot of the room before they go. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 05:26 PM
[YOU TAKE A PICTURE] Peregrine, another faded, blurred picture filled with static. But it is now ingrained in your film. A memory to keep, from another who have been lost.[YOU LEAVE TO THE HALL ONCE MORE].[ROOM 203: HAS CONCLUDED] @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine
6
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:31 PM
A calm before the storm. For a moment, Frankie's knees nearly give out from the chorus of gazes, each one roaring louder than the last until he was lost in the sound. Was that... the true form of the anomaly? So be it. It wasn't real. Black stains of charcoal fade to lovely rustic walls, the way they were before the flames. The man gone with Frankie standing where the dead once were. He hears his breathing clearly, and roots himself back into reality. WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE BURNED? The anomaly asks him this, and Frankie raises a question in kind. What would he gain from being burnt? Would he know pain? Come to regret what he already knows? It's a bit silly, Frankie thinks, to be so scared of fire, He once knew an anomaly, a few weeks back, who he let into his heart so easily yet he wouldn't burn for this one the same. "My world is simple, small, you see." Frankie starts, wondering if the anomaly is listening. "It's just me, and the things i've always known. The people that I love. Saffron. Peregrine. Erika. People that I look up to. Mika. Cameron. Ophelia. So, so many more." It's still such a small, small world. "I know there's more out there, I could find what's real, seek out the truth." He smiles, small, weak, "but, I choose to be ignorant of it." "People tell me I'm not fit to be a detective because I'm not concerned with the truth. For that matter they're right." At the start, Frankie took this job because he tells himself that he needs to live in the real world, but the truth-- or rather his truth is, he came to Meteor City chasing after the world of a loved one. "I'm here not for the real world, but for the worlds of those I love. I'll live in them. Follow them. Protect their world and my own. I don't need a dose of reality and gasoline." "Sorry. I'd love to listen to you one day. But not in fire."
9
Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:39 PM
Their room is concluded. Quietly, they shut the door behind them. The others didn't really need to see such a grisly scene, did they? More than that, that woman didn't deserve to have her death - her poor, few remains - viewed by prying eyes. A mercy onto her soul. Instinctively, they move to the room Frankie's in, only catching the tail end of his words. "A fire?" They pipe up, peeking into the room. Huh, nothing. They wonder what he must've seen. They'll ask him when they get home, if they get home. Lightly, they pat at his back, giving him a small smile. "I heard you throw up. You holdin' in okay? There should be a lil waterbottle in your bag if you need it." They're glad he seemed to be holding it together, but it was important to check in, especially him. He was small, a little frail in their eyes, almost like a baby bird. But they saw potential in him to be stronger, if only he cared to chase it. They hoped he would. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie

[ . . . ]The anomaly did not respond. How could it, after all? It had no mouth to speak here, even if they say walls could talk. There is no more light here, but maybe out there you can one day be someone who [LIGHTS] the way for those who are lost. 8
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 05:55 PM
He's alone again. The sudden darkness is pretty telling, and things seem quiet now, for real this time. Frankie doesn't miss those watchful eyes he felt though he wonders if the anomaly accepted his answer. Whether that mattered or not. He supposes the conclusion is what he makes of it, in his mind, he would like to imagine that man's family died with nothing but loving memories of him and that they made the most of every waking moment together. Even if it was merely just soaking in the presence of each other. As if on cue, Peregrine beckons him, finding Frankie in an ordinary motel room. It's funny, he thinks, for so much to happen in a short period of time and to amount to--well, just him and a plain, dingy room. Anticlimatic, sure, but that was kind of becoming his style. "Sorry, yeah.." Frankie rubs the back of his neck sheepishly, fingers cold still. "The anomaly was nice enough to clean the mess in this room though." But... "I'm glad to see you." What Frankie says is geniune. Though his relationship with Peregrine has always been. Him in his honest softness, and them with their strength and words. "I'm okay now, maybe it'll settle in after this mission and i'll relive the trauma later--but I think I'm just relieved." Frankie half jokes, "We should check on the others though." @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine
