santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 06:03 PM
And with the call of a [FRIEND], the key to your new [HOME] here. You return once more to the world that opened its doors for you[YOU LEAVE TO THE HALL ONCE MORE].[ROOM 201: HAS CONCLUDED] @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie

Peregrine (any) BOT 22-Dec-22 06:05 PM
"No need to apologize to me," they laugh out, hand still resting on his shoulder. "Not like I'm squeamish. That's pretty nice of it, though." They blink for a moment. I'm glad to see you. Those weren't words they heard very often admittedly; something they'd grown used to, a consequence of their personality. So they smile, something soft and genuine as well, pushing up the corners of their eyes. "Aw, really~? Well, I'm glad to see you too, all in one piece." They were relieved he hadn't been crushed under that weight, too. "I'll cover dinner tonight, how's that sound?" They say, as if they don't handle the cooking most nights. An act of unspoken care for those they shared a home with. After all, their father taught them nothing was kinder than food on the table. They allow their hand to fall away from him finally, turning their neck to look at the other doors. "You're probably right, yeah... There's still that last room to investigate, too." Much to think about, much to do. Busy, busy, busy. @north poleGOGO 🍊 Frankie
5
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 06:40 PM
A knot ties itself like roots in the pit of her stomach as everything begins to click. Miette thinks she gets it; it stung the first few times she failed to find her place. She wasn't bright enough, or pretty enough, she couldn't stand straight enough or talk loud enough. Sometimes she would end up as the girl in the photograph, much to the disappointment of her parents, and then she'd try to become one of the girls laughing at the table to make up for it. But that was so long ago. She's nothing, now, and she's fine with it as long as everyone's laughing with her. There's so much more you can do with wilted flowers, anyway. Right? It's a shame that others can't see that. ...and it's a shame that it doesn't stop her skin from itching, or her hair feeling wrong, or anything. Ugh. That's a her problem. She presses her fingers flat over her arm, soothing the faint scratches before she pulls her hand free— she elbows one of the flower-heads in doing so. Then she steels herself to approach the girl. Tough it out, like she always does. Miette can't bring herself to look at the corpse's face again, but is there anything on her body? @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

MIETTE (she/her) BOT 22-Dec-22 07:10 PM
The similarities make her skin crawl again. That could've been her. It still could, if she lets herself stumble. But not yet. There's still things to be done here. Miette tucks the ID away, the one silver lining of this all— though she's the last person who should be telling families about missing daughters. She'll... leave that part to someone else. She pauses again. ...she's still not brave enough to look at the girl's face, perhaps even less so after seeing her alive in photo, but a hand cautiously reaches towards the flowers coming from her mouth. Maeron Al Najjar BOT 22-Dec-22 07:30 PM
With an acrid bitterness, Maeron thought it quite clear what kind of place this became for the people who sought it out in an attempt to extinguish the residue of a painful past. Bone, skin, and heart. This was no haven. There was no hope, even the illusion of it. Sure an anomaly would present itself better than this if it was to convince someone otherwise. Perhaps it was punishment, self administered. Yes, that seemed the more logical conclusion: people wrapped up in guilt and grief, isolating themselves to a room in which their bodies were made to reflect the madness of their minds. Something tells Maeron that this is a prologue to a chapter, signifying a finality he had always saw coming. The beginning of the end Still feeling as numb as when he entered, and finding nothing else of note in the room, he retreats back to the door and crosses the threshold, not even bothering to close it behind him. There. Let everyone see your mawkish display of self-flagellation @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 22-Dec-22 07:42 PM
[MAERON] with bitterness you leave, seeing the ending that you may receive in the future. Whatever chapter will be your last, you wonder if it will be as terrible as this. Or [worse.] #Or Better. But can you see yourself with a better end? A room of self [PUNISHMENT] makes sense, it is what you could conclude. You will not wallow in what sins you've done, there are too many things left to do, and messes to clean. They won't do it themselves. #But who is it that tells you of this unsung duty?[YOU LEAVE TO THE HALL ONCE MORE][ROOM 201: HAS CONCLUDED] @★♪Azure🌻 Saif 🌩 Maeron ♪★

nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 21-Dec-22 06:50 PM
Towards the [house]. Your legs are heavy and your lungs burn when running through the shrouds of fog. Each breath tastes metallic but there is no blood. So many other feet, - paws, hooves, boots - add to the race. Your end goals are different. You just need to reach it - Reach that door and all will be ok. They want to reach you. You can ignore the stroke of a hand just missing your hair to grab you as long as the house is in sight. The handle rattles. The door opens with no resistance. You stumble inside with the veteran and shut the world behind you. [Silence falls once again.] (edited)

4
nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 22-Dec-22 09:55 AM
It's dark in here.A darkness beyond the darkness you've ever experienced - darker than when you shut your eyes tightly at night, Darker than an alleyway in a seedy part of town, #Darker than inky night devoid of stars. For at least in those situations, a glimmer is ever present, whether it is the muted orange of light able to traverse closed, thin eyelids or the cast of the sun reflecting off the moon to break up gloomy blackened skies. But [no Light touches here]. Like the bottom of a narrowing chasm. Like looking into the centre of a black hole. Though you cannot see anything, your surroundings seem to warp from an oppressiveness and immense gravity that weighs down your frame. It pulls. Pulling you down. Deeper. [Deeper.]#There is something deeper, and it is crushing you on its quest to embrace you. Feed on you.You will become one with the dark if you don't find light soon enough.A trembling hand scours the wall for a light switch, finger barely grazing its nodule before the [hallway is bathed in brightness]. It hurts at first when your eyes forcibly adjust to its intensity, but within a few seconds, the light is no brighter than any you've seen. Just a regular house on a regular street. You almost forget you've experienced anything else in here. Generic in design, yet you cannot help but feel a sense of nostalgia. Like rewatching the home in your favourite childhood film or even reliving your own. What would you see when you opened that front door and stepped inside?Feel free to answer ic before we start or during! What is [home]? Was? What was your childhood [fear]? (edited)

Agent Egeberg BOT 22-Dec-22 01:36 PM
There is subtle puzzlement in his eyes. He remembers stumbling inside, and now he stands upright in a lit hallway with the small group as if they had just entered the home. But why was his hand hovering over the socket? To turn it off? The agent rescinds his hand to pick up his gun from the ground, still slick and foul-smelling from secretions when its barrel had crumpled skull. A quick check of the magazine. Out of bullets. He quietly curses to himself before looking at the home's interior. (edited)

Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 22-Dec-22 02:42 PM
Ah, dark. After the encounter just moments, ago, the deafening silence of the pitch black hallway was almost relieving. A childhood fear you eventually grow used to. Gradually. Through the darkroom washed in blood red, waiting with bated breath for the reveal on the black photo paper. Through continually throwing yourself into the dark unknown, expecting to come back out of it in one piece (mostly). Something they've come to expect out of this job. It's a moment of uncertainty followed by a reveal. For the most part. It's become a pattern. It offers some kind of comfort. Except for when the reveal step doesn't come. But we don't think about that one. This time was the same - the flash of white blinds Jamie for a moment, forcing a yelp out of her again, before her eyesight adjusts itself to the light. It's just a house. Homey, despite the lack of any life in here...? She takes a moment to recollect herself, check her inventory and wipe some of the blood off of her face, and later hands. She wouldn't want to make her camera dirty. [MAG 6] @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd
6
Ophelia Leclair BOT 22-Dec-22 03:01 PM
The darkness causes a quiver of unease to slither up her spine, gritting her teeth as she slapped a hand against a wall. While she wasn't deathly afraid of the dark as much as she was of drowning, it wasn't any more pleasant in this environment than any other. Her palm slid across the wall as she tried to find a switch, only to lurch and instinctively cover her eyes when someone else did instead. "Pour l'amour du ciel..." She muttered under her breath as she opened her eyes gradually, looking at the interior. A regular home... with a touch of nostalgia. Why? She's never been here before. Home is where Lilou is, was and will be— a generic answer you'd likely get from any mother who cares. It was also the dining table where she sat and hummed before dinner was served, the papers littering the floor with crayon drawings and the joyful tunes the tv played when she watched her favourite show. None of which were here right now. "Jamie? Are you— are you alright?" She managed eventually, eyes flicking to the girl who just yelped. She felt a strange sort of... solidarity? Seeing what's essentially your clone was something she had to go through as well, after all. [MAG 2] @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd @pepomint 📸 jamie/shaun/darren

Soma Lee (He/him) BOT 22-Dec-22 03:10 PM
Seeing the house from the outside, Soma didn't think it would be this dark coming in ...It's honestly unnerving, but his mind was more preoccupied by the immediate threat lurking outside that he forcefully pushed any unpleasant thoughts out in favor of fumbling with the doorknob and its lock. ...? Come to think of, where was the door? Falsely believing there was a wall to catch him, he stumbled backwards. There seemed to be a misjudgement in his position. He trips and falls on his behind, nearly knocking someone over in the process. "Oof!" And then the light. Oh. He wasn't even anywhere near the door. It had been so dark that he'd gotten disoriented. "Is, is everyone okay?" MAG 18 (edited)

Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 22-Dec-22 03:18 PM
Darkness. It's an instinctive, human, fear some people can grow out of. Some fears are innate while others are instilled. Hayden grew out of that childish fear so very long ago, she had to. She wanted to. She called Hayden by Hikaru, and Hikaru was determined to be the star that shined brightest for her. So what happened, Hikaru? Hayden starts to feel uneasy the longer the darkness seemed to envelop her. This house feels all too familiar, the opression it holds. But this house is not a home, not to her at least. Hayden hisses and winces as light finally fills the void. It takes a moment for her eye to adjust to her surroundings and she's pulled back to reality. "Everyone get inside in one piece?" nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 22-Dec-22 08:03 PM
The child is huddled underneath a blanket, small frame shuddering as they quietly sniffle and cry. "Daddy..." They've cried for so long they should run out of tears, even in the dimness, you can catch the reflection of light against their wet face. "Mommy..?" Ophelia Leclair BOT 22-Dec-22 09:08 PM
She couldn't breathe. This was worse than any fear she's experienced before, a raspy breath stuttering out of her throat. Water or no water, she couldn't see or understand what just hit her. She was drowning. It felt like her head was going to split open from the pressure of being crushed or pulled, crumpled up like a piece of paper. Even so, she wasn't the only one she was living for in this moment. It would've been so much easier to give up, otherwise. Laughably easy, in fact, which made her wonder if she ever saw much worth in herself at all. ... Even so, she would reach out, regardless whether or not it was futile, so she could at least know that she tried. @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd
6
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 22-Dec-22 09:11 PM
... She doesn't want to sink though. She doesn't think about sinking being an option right now. It goes against common sense - in situations where you're in the middle of deep water, without land in sight, or fallen through ice into a lake with no way out, it's usually more sensible to preserve energy and remain calm until help comes. But this is different. She doesn't have the luxury to wait. You need to keep moving or you'll die, most likely. Move in whatever direction, with the intention of finding a way out, a surface to break through. Or find someone else who needs help, just like you. Cause two heads are better than one. Stuck in the same shit situation, you'll find a way out together. Hope, some might call it. Or a desperate need for survival. It's open to interpretation. She's reaching out for whatever she can get a hold of. @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd

If Carson had stayed at home, he might have never had to let Bradley off with a warning. Carson rubs his face to clear the blood around his eyes. He wasn't even aware that there were clear tracks through the blood from his tears. It should feel cathartic. To hear that apology. LQCC - ⛪│church
LQCC
🌁 ISLE OF SILENCE / ⛪│church
nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 23-Dec-22 11:59 AM
There is a full congregation at the church tonight. (edited)
11:59
The [crisis response teams were busy completing their objectives] parallel to your own, and the pews are filled with many people seated alongside your group. Tired, dirty, injured - in varying states of distress after their own physical and mental battles with the island's conjurations. Some sniffle and sob while others sit motionless, numb, far past the brink of their emotional capacity. (edited)
12:00
Like a fleet of worker bees, [the medics flit about the rows providing essential emergency care to those in need]. Just enough aid until they can be transported to a hospital as soon as they embark from the docks. Your injuries are included. Bandages, ointment, disinfectant - you feel like shit, but at least you're in a better physical state than when you entered the church. (edited)
12:00
The siren continues its haunting drone, and animalistic snarls echo within the fog, yet inside the church's walls, it almost feels easy to forget their existence. Almost. It's muffled and muted but always there. (edited)
12:01
For some of you, this is your [first night away from home] for a mission. Others have had their fair share of overnight stays, though in situations unlike the one you're in now. (edited)
12:01
[Some of you may have managed to sleep] in your exhaustion. [Some of you may have stayed awake] the whole night, expecting something to attack. And yet the stained glass windows remain intact in all their [fragility]. As does the shut wooden doors. How long for? You're unsure. You think you've heard the faintest sounds of [snapping and cracking in the stone walls], but that could be in your head. #A trick of the world you're in; a product of an overactive mind; having far too many experiences where things go wrong. (edited)
12:02
[But night passes, and morning is anew.] The church is bathed in a kaleidoscope of colour as daylight traverses its windows. (edited)
12:03
@silence you may post
Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:21 PM
Staying overnight had certainly not been an expectation of theirs, and there's a bit of disappointment of having to stay on this awful island for the night instead of their warm bed back home. But it is what it is, and they must march on. Being in a church like this reminds them a bit of home - the one they used to get dragged along to on Sundays frankly wasn't in much of a better shape than this one now, consequence of existing in the rural country. It's not entirely comforting - church was never their favorite place to be - but it's enough to keep their mind occupied. Though their first time staying overnight, Peregrine easily takes up the mantel of staying up and helping keep watch, having sustained no injuries of their own. They've pulled many all-nighters in their college days, and even younger, when they had to watch over the chicken coop during coyote season, gun or whatever other weapon kept right by their bed to chase them off at a moment's notice. There's a few times in the night where they allow themself to doze off - they know it's better than to completely exhaust themself and risk total sleep deprivation when they haven't gotten off this island yet. Currently, they lay down on their back in one of the pews, a hand raised in the air to catch the colorful light of the stained glass windows, slowly turning this way and that to watch them shift. Ah, morning now. Better than the dark of the night, they supposed. With a yawn, they drop their hand back onto their stomach, staring up at the ceiling. If they were to be honest, the worst part about this was simply being so bored and cooped up the whole night. Maybe this is what the chickens felt like? Prey huddled inside wood and stone walls, able to hear the snarls and barks of predators just outside. Sighing, they push themself upright, head tilting to the side to help pop their stiff neck. They wanted to go home soon. They wanted to call their parents, see how they were doing. "Do you guys
12:21
think we'll be able to get going soon...?" They ask to no one in particular, eyes flitting along to their fellow detectives.
Ophelia Leclair BOT 23-Dec-22 12:23 PM
It happened again. She has to count on Bonnie again. Though, should she really be surprised anymore, with this job? She knew what she was in for, even after all of OW. Things wouldn't be fixed so easily, there would always be times she had to stay overnight. At the very least, she learned to be more transparent, sure. That sometimes, bad things would happen on the job. That mom can't always come back the same day... but that Lilou must remember that she's doing it for her. That she would be back. But that didn't make it any easier. Even with those thoughts, she slept like a rock, unable to be paranoid through her exhaustion. In the morning, she blinked sluggishly - pushing herself up and rubbing beneath her eyelids. She felt like a pile of bricks, a low groan leaving her... Truly, she had no idea how she survived being slammed against a wall by a bed. Everything hurt. The frustration of the past few jobs began catching up with her, wiping at her eyes with the back of her hand to dab away some tears. "... As everyone wakes up, I am sure we'll be able to get going." She speaks up in response to Peregrine, her hand sinking from her face as she forced herself off her feet. @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 12:31 PM
She's always hated churches. Bianca eyes her bite wound, newly disinfected, cleaned up, restitched and bandaged. She didn't really want to interact with the crisis team more than necessary, so she probably found one of their own to take another look at it. She sits at an isolated pew with her legs tucked up to her chest, watching the windows, all night long. It was a place she felt she didn't belong, even as a kid. A deep seated discomfort for every sunday mass, every holiday her foster family was insistent she attend. It'd been a nice few years where her adoptive fathers didn't make her go. Neither of them were the religious sort; something she'd never taken the time to be grateful for until now. She doesn't sleep, wide awake, replaying the elevator scene in her head, bathed in red light. Rewinding the gunshot, meticulously combing through her actions and only growing more irate when there's no clean answer to be found. Spending the night at this island wasn't something she wanted. Especially surrounded by people like this, in various states of emotional disarray. It feels like her skin's crawling. Her clothes are still disgusting; it's hard to relax when all she can smell is rust and rot. Even in here. Even in these 'perfect, sanctioned' walls. Was it really safe to have everyone cornered in one place like this? It felt like a fucking joke.
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:35 PM
Despite everything they've been put through, Jamie was able to doze off for a couple of minutes during the night, on and off, just to catch some rest. Kind of like how she usually sleeps at home. Maybe the knowledge that everyone from their agency has made it back in one piece (for the most part) gave her some form of comfort. Safety. It was just more of the same again. She's been hurt in worse way before, and has been covered from head to toe in blood before. That, probably adds to the comfort of it all, as well...? Kind of fucked up, but what can you do. That's what you get from time to time while working at this agency. She's awake by the time the others start waking up, seated somewhere on the ground and fiddling around with her camera. Somehow it's stayed in tact, only getting covered in some blood. Hopefully it didn't get on the film inside it. ... But she really wants a shower right now.
Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 12:35 PM
The motel had been haunting in its own right, gruesome visions on display and the echoes of memories ricocheting against the walls. But it was nothing compared to the journey to the church, shadows and sounds of unintelligible nature lurking just beyond any visible periphery. Maeron hadn't slept the whole night. He may have dozed off once or twice, eyelids heavy with weariness and begging for respite, but his mind was a bedlam so cacophonous that he could hardly keep them closed for very long. He wonders how long it will be until they are able to return. He certainly couldn't stay away like this for vey long. And it would be a bitter irony should he end up like some of the other people on this island, letting it eat away at them for one reason or another because of whatever misery they held within them. No, Maeron wouldn't end up like that. Worst case scenario, he would figure something out on his own.
Soma Lee (He/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:36 PM
Soma arrives at the church along with the others, covered head to toe in blood. He jokes with the medics as best as he can, even in the amount of pain he's in. He smiles at the others, nodding and shaking his head, no I'm fine. Yes, I'll be alright. No, it doesn't hurt that much. Yes, isn't it crazy?! A whole bed post! It's the least he can do, seeing how tired and worn out everyone else looked. Ah, but Soma was a good liar. He didn't lie much, but when he did, it was easy to believe him. A virtue of his honesty, he thinks. He gets away with a lot of little lies like these. Ugh. It hurt like shit. He hopes this doesn't get infected. Actually, there's no chance in hell it won't be. Soma thinks he wakes up several times during his sleep, or was he already awake? He really couldn't tell. All he knew was that by the time the sunlight was beginning to trickle in through stained glass window, he was still tired. Tired enough that he was still asleep by the time everyone else was starting to wake up. He thinks, if he was going to be awake through the night, he should have offered to act as a nightwatch with the others. For the time being... Five more minutes. He snores softly.
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 23-Dec-22 12:37 PM
She had woken up several times through the night from the throbbing pain in her shoulder. But also because as peaceful as this church was, anxious thoughts had definitely run through her head and in her dreams, replaying what had happened in the hospital. Would the church stay peaceful? She doubted it. Though her sleep was not as restful as she would have liked it to be, she was grateful nonetheless for this temporary tranquility. Doris blinks her eyes open early in the day, witnessing the kaleidoscope of colour shine through the stained glass windows. Beautiful. Hopeful, despite knowing why they were all in here and what was going on just outside. She slowly pushes herself up from her laying position, wincing at the sharp pang of pain that shoots through her shoulder and down her arm. Perhaps she should have slept upright instead… She lets out a shaky breath, other hand gingerly checking on the bandage that was covering the stitches Asteria had made. She pulls her hand away to see her fingers come off a bit wet with blood. Hm. She should probably replace the gauze before they continue whatever it is they need to do.
Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 23-Dec-22 12:40 PM
Hayden's lost track over how long they've all been on this island at this point but her experience sure has been an odd one. It still took some getting used to, trodding through and having others follow behind. But maybe it was more so carrying the burdens of others, you have to keep going for them. Every once and awhile she'd glance back to Carson and Bradley, perhaps their unsavory reunion really was a blessing in disguise. Like Sin and Atonement, they need each other now to hold each other accountable... for living. Maybe one day they can all truly find new reasons to keep living, hopefully. But Hayden felt it, the weight of their sins, the weight of their guilt. She feels her own every waking moment of her life, after all. But she's encountered so many like her during her time at LQCC. Mercy, forgiveness, and compassion... she supposes it's what some people need most to keep going. She wonders if she's deserving of it too. When they reached the church, Hayden hardly had a moment's rest as there's still so much left to do when they're on a mission like this. "Oh right, since we've managed to find some survivors, do any of these items look familiar to anyone?" Hayden walks around asking, holding up the little evidence bag containing a wedding band and enamel pin. Did I mention she's soaked in blood? The evidence bag is fine tho..or should be anyway @nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley IDK WHO TO TAG
Magnolia Faragher BOT 23-Dec-22 12:40 PM
Despite it being an uneventful night, Magnolia hardly slept a wink. It's too careless to sleep in the midst of enemy's territory, her night was instead spent monotonously sharpening the scalpel she collected. She was considerate enough to rest in a corner, at least. A distance away from those that are seeking rest. Guilt, huh? The only hint that they got. Without more pieces of the puzzle, there's only so much that she could deduce, The true nature of the anomaly still remains shrouded in mystery. She believe that the whole island itself is part of the anomaly and with how many years that this has been going on, just how much power has it amassed? And how would they be able to fight back? Magnolia purposefully kept the case's detail away from Malachy, the last thing she wanted is to give him unnecessary worry. She'll make it back to him. LQCC dealt with worse. Although, that point does make her sympathize with the newbies.... She only noticed morning has arrived when her co-workers start to shuffle awake. Good morning. (edited)
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:45 PM
For him, the church was a thankful reprise from the chaos of the motel. Basking in the quiet of the busybee conundrum crisis workers have created around them--it was easier to get lost in the moment like this. And when all fell quiet (truly, truly quiet), Frankie watched with owlish eyes, attempting to make out a moon from the fog. He couldn't sleep like this, Frankie tells himself, eyelids heavy and heart wary. The last thing he wanted was to immerse himself in the unpredictable nature of dreams. At least.... at least... in this way he can kind of control the things he sees...... It wasn't long after that for sleep to lull him in for good. It was a dreamless sleep, from an exhausted mind too weary to think in the resting state it so desperately needed. Nothing happened. Not in his dreams and not in the real world either. The first thing Frankie did when waking up was to do a bleary-eyed headcount, making sure no one disappeared in the night. Maybe it was a mercy to have this nothingness, in a situation like this. Silently, he thanks the anomaly for this period of safety, for what it's worth.
Asteria Galanis (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:45 PM
The researcher didn't sleep well, she's been staring out the windows in endless thought. Nodding off every now and then. Staying well far away from Doris, Bianca, Magnolia and Eclaire. She didn't want to have to explain herself anymore than she already had. She didn't even realize that morn had come. Turning head when Hayden calls out, waving the personal affects around and recognizing the very specific blue glint of the precious stone. Asteria rises to her feet. "That would be my ring." She says weakly, her face more pensive than relieved seeing the wedding band again. "Thank you for finding it." @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 12:54 PM
Miette's pretty good at sleeping anywhere, she thinks, but how could she sleep in a place like this? Every time she found herself dozing off, she'd flinch awake moments later. She can't tell if the scratching sounds are real or if it's just someone shifting in their sleep or if she's just imagining it, exhaustion tugging at her mind. So her night is spent with her knees pulled close, fingers picking at the end of the forget-me-not, back against the farthest church pew and eyes watching the door— something that she notices becomes a little easier as the sun begins to rise, colors slowly inching over the room. She'd think it was pretty if everything wasn't so fucked up. She picks at bits of flower stem scraped under her fingernail. She wants to go home. At least her skin's stopped crawling.

12:56
As the LQCC stirs awake, your partner teams are already underway in collecting their materials and preparing the missing for the journey from the island.
12:56
They, too, are in varying states of injury like yourselves, some needing to lean on their colleagues, arms locked, to even walk towards the church's door. At least the black uniforms camouflage any now-dried blood that mars their suits, though that characteristic metallic scent isn't suppressed.
12:57
For those observant, a few faces you may have passed during your briefing are missing from the current group. The forlornness underneath the veil of professionalism can give you a conclusion about their fates. But what is sacrificing yourself for others in this field of service? That's what you've done - most of you have done - as private investigators at LQCC. Sometimes, that's simply what's expected when you work for duty. (edited)
12:57
The crackling walkie-talkies break the silence more than the chatter or rustles of motion as the Crisis Response sorts out the logistics for retreat.
Agent Egeberg BOT 23-Dec-22 12:59 PM
Egeberg rubs his back as he stretches out uncomfortably, overseeing the march of people out into the fog. His finger rests against the walkie-talkie, awaiting instruction. The static is uncomfortably loud but it feels safe here to use it. At least sparingly.
Agent Egeberg BOT 23-Dec-22 01:07 PM
Now this next message over the walkie-talkie wasn't one he wanted to hear. With a grimace, he heads over to those at LQCC. "Hey fellahs, we got some bad news- There's an accident further up the lake, and our convoy of boats has been redistributed to help out the efforts there. That means...we've hit capacity with the boats. Doesn't help so many are injured or need serious medical aid for the whole journey if we want 'em to survive." "We'll get the missin' off as fast as we can and try to get those boats back to collect you as quick as possible. You'll jus'...have to hold on a little while longer in here. Just wanted to let you know."

Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 01:12 PM
How poetic that the church would be their sanctuary. Eclaire does not believe, nor did most of her family take stock in any of it. Though sometimes she’d wonder if it would have brought her any comfort. Would heartfelt words to a non-responsive being bring some manner of relief from world weariness? Should she kneel now, beg and negotiate, just in case? Just in case… She wishes to pace. Do a patrol around the walls of the church, look out the window into foggy darkness.. Something of use. Anything. Instead she sits, staring blankly at the altar as she’s patched up. Nodding when she’s told to rest, not to stand for now: be useless. Adrenaline has long left her and she feels the aches and dull pains all over. Reminders of her rashness, her unsound intuition. Chiding her after every breath. She welcomes it—such things are part and parcel for a fighter, and pain is to be expected. Normal. Not a wink of sleep graces her. Or more aptly, is permitted by her. In silent vigil she sits still, one of her biggest shortcomings once again rearing its ugly head. How many was it now, today? Her inability to truly know how to relax keeps her in stiff posture, and if it not for the steady rise and fall of her shoulders she would be perfectly statue-like. One part of her thinks this is apt punishment for a disgraceful showing, another lies that this is meditation, another: as if you know how to properly meditate. She hushes all of this and decides it’s patrolling. The light of dawn finally streams through, the hall bathed in multicolour rays, and she finally stirs. Head raising to view the windows. Like this, ‘tis quite easy to believe in divine beings, she supposes. She stands up and stretches while Agent Egeberg delivers his news, then folds her arms across her chest. “Terrible news for a terrible situation. ‘Tis understandable, though. I believe those in dire need of medical assistance should be evacuated first. They’ve been here longer, after all.”
Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 01:14 PM

After their last mission giving them a glimpse into her home life, they could only imagine her worry and guilt over not being home with her daughter right now. Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 01:17 PM
Of course. Maeron resisted the urge to throw his hands up in exasperation. After already having to spend an unforeseen night in this place, they want us to wait even longer. There was no point in giving a response; it wasn't even a question. The crisis response team was going to prioritize the people in crisis. And no one was going to be able to convince them-- or the people who had gone missing, for that matter, to stay behind while the detectives who helped find them got to leave. Maeron slumps into one of the pews, annoyance plain on his face. Maybe he'd figure a way out on his own after all
Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 01:17 PM
Frankie nods solemnly at this news. It's the right call. The missing are far more vulnerable than experienced anomaly investigators, even if--they were powerless against one of this nature and size. Just hang on for a little while longer, he thinks, trusting in his peers to be able to have his back. They're good, reliable folk. Though he worries for those from the hospital, having heard they went through a physical battle, Frankie can't help but think they are the ones that need rest most out of anyone else in their group. He can wait. He's spent his whole life waiting. Frankie says nothing as the others ask the agent questions. Fingers curling together in apprehensive fists. Be well. Stay safe. Get home quickly, he prays for those from the accident further ahead, hoping that in their haste, at least their departure will be a smooth one.

13:43
Before you realise it, the only light in the church is the candles positioned equidistant from each other against the walls. The snarls sound right outside, the walls your only barrier from their hunger. You. You've taken their sustenance. The windows crack, and crack, and the church's door thuds. Worn and aged, they are easily compromised by the swarm that suddenly invade your shelter. You're overwhelmed.

Magnolia Faragher BOT 23-Dec-22 02:12 PM

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 02:14 PM
He clutches at the baton in his head. Such a silly weapon, it felt so, so heavy in Frankie's hand, the weight of which is still nothing against the crushing presence of this anomaly. Still, he clings onto it like a lifeline. "I don't know, try using all your strength--" he says to Hayden, trying not to let the panic in his voice show. (edited)

Hayden barges into the door, and it opens with little resistance, inviting to seek solace behind its walls. It closes shut with a loud thud as a reminder of its shielding prowess. Sturdy and strong, the scrapes and barges from the other side are futile, even pitiful.
14:24

14:25

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 02:39 PM
Guilt. Old acquaintance of his, his most loyal friend, and the sickness that wont leave his shadow. Frankie really isn't all too much different from those who had fallen into the jaws of this anomaly, feasted upon. His limbs feel like soup against the walls of the inner church, sludge in his veins. And he tries. So he tries. To see. To watch, with his eyes, to understand himself. To understand the anomaly. To look for the reason why he's still alive, standing, after everything that has occured on this island, and why he continues to stay standing. It couldn't be something as simple as mere, exhaustful, hope. With weak hands Frankie entrusts his eyes to finish the job.
8
Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 23-Dec-22 02:42 PM
How long has Hayden wallowed in regret? Let it swallow her whole? How long has she let regret dictate her life and ruin it? She could’ve very well been seduced to come here by this island like its past victims as well. Is that how she wanted it all to end for herself? To be a victim left unidentified or unclaimed amongst the sea of other unfortunate and miserable souls cast into the lake of inferno? No, Hayden’s already spent her time in hell. She has the burn scars to prove it. In this chapel, it was time for her to put hell in its place, even if it’ll burn her alive.
7
6
Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 02:49 PM
For their entire life, Peregrine has been nothing but action, brute forcing their heart to bear any weight placed upon them. They march through life with clenched fists and a bright smile, never faltering in their step. They knew who they were, what they were, what their purpose was and what they were meant to be. To be the stalwart star in the face of adversity, shining bright and scalding hot to make things better. So why would they ever feel guilt? They've fumbled through life, tripped and made their mistakes. Bridges burnt, people hurt, truths too harsh. Yet, they never held regret for almost any of it. That was life - to fail and try again, to fall and keep getting up, again and again and again. No matter how many times they scraped their knees and scratched their palms, they would always get up again and step forward into the future. They would not allow the past to weigh on them. They would not allow themself to be judged for the life they have lived. After all, they've done the best they ever have could. That's what anyone does - the best that they can. Guilt will not consume them, and they won't allow for it to consume their comrades, either. So they will grab the future with their bare hands, break its jaw and rip it to shreds. They will not wait for the world to be kind; they will make that reality on their own.
7
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 02:54 PM
There must be a reason why this group of people was able to see the island and come to it. Just like the missing people they've retrieved so far. Regret. Guilt. They all must share it, in some way. Jamie too, she's come to realize. Regret from chances missed. Guilt from actions taken. People she's disappointed or hurt. It all weighs on you, whether you want it or not. It's difficult to fully ignore. But you can't let it immobilize you. You have to keep moving, away from the past and towards a future where you can do things differently. For the better. She has too many things she still want to do, has to do. You can digest these thoughts while you're moving along. No time to sit still. These hands still have work to do.
7
Magnolia Faragher BOT 23-Dec-22 02:57 PM
When she let the fire consumed her co-workers, she never thought she did anything wrong. She was simply reaching out for what she needed, the people that was caught in-between was collateral damage. Nothing more, she was never one to be attached to her colleagues. Yet nothing less, she never intended them to be in harm's way. She suppose a normal person would have been wracked by guilt. She was quite proud to feel nothing. But even a proud woman was not without weakness. It's truly pitiable that her true source of guilt was something so...mundane. Her son, she watched him grew to become his own person. Then, She lets go. Isn't that what all parents do? All kids have to leave their nest someday, she would hate to be an overbearing mother. Malachy never quite forgave her for that. She never understands why.
10
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:00 PM
Living in misery is not a life lived— those words are synonymous with her whole being. But Miette figures, in part, that some misery must still nip at her heels. It's why she keeps moving, why she's weighing her options for when something breaks and goes wrong (like it hasn't already. doesn't this count?). It's why she's here, probably, and why that room made her skin crawl. For years, it was the hands of others pushing and pulling and shaping her into things that never felt quite right. And it's so liberating to be free of it all. She doesn't let those hands shape her anymore. Only she can make and unmake herself, nurse the grazes on her palms when she falls and gets back up again and moves onto the "next big thing". ...what is the next big thing? Her eyes weigh heavy with fatigue. It's her hands that reach for the baton, answering her own question; maybe she can try being half as brave as the rest of the people here.
9
Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 03:01 PM
Maeron had always lived a life with little attention given to the way others viewed him, perceived him, judged him. It was pointless, when he never quite felt like he belonged to himself. And it meant that he had always refused to feel like he belonged to anyone else. And it worked. For awhile, it worked. For his whole life, up until a certain point. Maeron had always lived a life without regrets until then too. After all, there wasn't much to regret when each day was about going through the motions-- again, and again, and again. And when it stopped being that way, when things-- for the briefest of moments, for only a fragment of time-- weren't just nauseating repetition. When each day was different, when he had something to anticipate. And then it fell apart, due entirely to his own subversion. He wouldn't let himself feel it. He wouldn't let himself feel regret, or guilt. It had to be done, after all. It was necessary, no matter how much he hated that it thrust him back into the every day monotony. Maeron had learned something valuable that day. He learned that doing something different, breaking away from that tortuous routine, would only lead to misery. So he wouldn't. He'd stay right where he was made to be, whether it was his choice or not. Because it was easier. Because it was safer, even if only in his own mind. Even if he'd surely not see another summer, living like this. But that was alright. It had only taken one summer to learn everything he needed to know. About himself. About his life. About how it would end. And this was, undoubtedly, the beginning of the final act. There would be no more to learn then.
10
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 23-Dec-22 03:14 PM
Guilt was something Doris was keenly familiar with, though it’s song had grown quiet in her heart over the past few years, the melody was still there. It was probably why she was here. A note for surviving when her father didn’t, a note for the times she was unable to do more. It was a song that she’d probably never not know, but she had learned to live with. There were so many experiences where Doris stayed frozen, watching on the sidelines, unable to get herself to take action. She thinks about Caroline, that day in the mansion. Could things have gone differently if she had done something? Those labyrinths where she let herself get caught up in dreams, would others have come out less scathed if she had been stronger at resisting, instead of wishing so badly those dreams could be real? Yet as the song of guilt pangs in her heart, she thinks of that artifact that had called to her back in Kansas and the way it reminded her that she just needed to trust herself a bit more. Doris was used to watching, to observing, to learning from her mistakes. She might be the type to wallow in emotions, but she always got back up.
7
Soma Lee (He/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:14 PM
Family members, friends, acquaintances and even strangers. If all gathered together and asked what made Soma, well- him, one word would probably come to mind: Shameless. Admittedly, he's a simple man. Regrets come and go like rainy clouds to sunny days. It's no more than a period of bad weather. Easy to come by, easy to forget. He's seen more than his fair share of men, women, people all wallowing in their guilt. Over the "what ifs" the "could've"s the "should've"s. Soma thinks they have a good heart, but he fails to see the point. What's done is done, get over it. He tells them this and he gets a glass of water splashed on him in return. He never takes it personally. Just takes the force of their hurt without complaint. Sometimes they apologize, and sometimes they don't. He doesn't take that personally, either. Because he's guilty, too. Never knows what to say. No matter how well-meaning, his words have caused, brought a lot of pain and suffering to loved ones. He never learned to shut his mouth, never learned how to cushion the blow. He's learning though, isn't he? He makes mistakes so he can learn from them. And thank you for dumping that glass of water on him, that way he won't forget. Thank you for not apologizing. That tells him he was in the wrong. The consequences are his twisted trophies. They're his and his alone.
10
10
Eclaire Bellam (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:15 PM
Gloved hands grip tighter on the bone saw's handle. It's unfamiliar. It’s not her sword. Even then, this must be bad form. She slowly adjusts her grip, fingers loosening slightly, the Bellam Eye motif stretching along the back of her hand. All she ever does is act. Maybe it does gnaw on her, a little. A lot. Even when she barely had time to self-reflect for now. Actions are faster, more meaningful to her. She’d joked to Heath that, as observant as she thought she was, the House’s symbol suited him better. He had chuckled lightly at that, and agreed. ’’Tis part of my duties,’ he’d said. She had wanted to ask of him—and I? Should I not be more like you? More befitting of such a symbol? Will I not carry and embody it as is expected of me? —but she had laughed it off in agreement. It feels as if it’s burning now. The back of both of her hands, where the eye stares, always. The third eye motif hidden, on the back of her blouse, a symbol of knowing, of seeing behind you. The last one: gone now, crumbled away on the blade of her sword. A symbol all too familiar to her, when it was present everywhere back home. Unsettling! Was a common thing to hear visitors say. Sometimes sections of the manor was open to visitors. An old tradition for Great Houses still practiced. This anomaly is not the judge, no, for her it would be the Eyes. But you get used to all the eyes eventually. It served more as a reminder to her to see, to observe, to know. He’d know what to do in her place. He would’ve learnt more now. Stayed back, strategised, let the others take a few blows for analysis. She needed to emulate him. Learn from him. And now, faced with this decision, the pain still present on her tensed thigh, the reminder of her regret: She needed to do—no—to be better. She needs to see.

nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 23-Dec-22 03:17 PM
Please pause! Post incoming!
15:17
"Your choice is final," it whispers.
15:18
The only sounds that follow are your own breathing and the gentle crackling of flames lighting the room. You’ve picked your choice. Gave it an answer. Did it even matter? Once again, It’s you alone in here.
15:18
And then you hear it.
15:18
A sound so shrill and thundering; a replay of every sound you’ve ever heard, or haven’t heard, or thought you heard - it’s unimaginable and bombarding your senses. Every action, inaction, every feeling of joy and hurt and guilt and retribution- every moment in your life is overlaid in this cacophony of unintelligible madness. The noise of life. Of living. (edited)
15:19
Your body resonates with its frequency, your world shakes as your eyeballs dance to its intoxicating music. Your heart, too, shifts its beats to match the thumps of its bassline. It's hard to take deep breaths. It's hard to think.
15:19
You hear so much that you hear nothing at all.
15:20
You can't even hear yourself scream but your throat feels raw.
15:20
Your body feels as if it's being tugged and tugged and tugged apart, a tort piece of string pulled beyond its capacity until it Snaps. It's a clean and sharp - a knife's blade through paper. (edited)
15:20
You feel split in half.
15:21
The world is black.
15:21
And then it's not.

Agent Egeberg BOT 23-Dec-22 07:45 PM
They're both covered in the fine mist of chalk, Carson forcibly looking up at the skies above them in his immobilized state. The fires are snuffed from the church's collapse, and whatever was inside would be mangled beyond recognition. The dense rock keeps his legs clamped against the ground, but he's grateful that Liu had his youthful reaction time to push these old bones away from near death. Near centimetres beside his head lays a pillar. With his free hands and teamwork, the manageable blocks are slowly pulled off his legs. He's too exhausted to feel pain. The clear blue skies fill him with peace. Not even a fine mist is present to sully its clarity. Whatever they're doing - wherever they are - is working.

nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 23-Dec-22 08:10 PM
Heavy plods kick up the rising water as Cameron, Ashley and Rena arrive at the location, eyes honed in on the undulating mass of rock. It breathes, expanding and contracting, shuddering as if in pain though those were simply anthropomorphic traits applied to an inanimate object than anything organic. Cameron lowers her firearm to swiftly sling it over her shoulder while they help Carson escape the stone tomb encasing his legs. They need to move fast before this thing may collapse even further, or erupt.
20:17
Crack. Crack. Crack. They pull Carson away just before the mound of church falls into the chasm, and you are spat out. You're caked in white powder that clings to the blood coating your bodies. Just a moment ago, all you saw was darkness. Whiteness. But now you see blue. (edited)

20:22

nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 23-Dec-22 08:34 PM
Rena holds Carson up, his legs unable to transport him to the end. Ashley and Bullseye trail behind, keeping you covered on all sides. Like passing through a ghost town, this silence holds a different quality than before. A vacancy of what hosted life, whether malicious or otherwise. The only things inhabiting the island outside of you are dead. How many missing will find graves at sea? How many families will remain in perpetual limbo, wondering whether their loved one will return home today? They had no names by the time you met them on the island. It was too late to find those. Too late now. That is life. Saving all is merely wishful thinking. But you are dreamers who still try to do the unthinkable. Who else could kill what seemed to be unkillable? An entire landmass sinks because of your sheer will to dream and hope for more. And so many people will return home because of it too. You, as LQCC.

Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 08:43 PM
They're silent as they trudge along to follow to the boats, save for the occasional sniffle, ready to escape from this utter hellscape. Rust is mingled with the chalk and blood on their hands, the only remains left behind of their wonderfully lethal weapon that reminded them of home. They were too tired to let their mind wander any further now. As they sit, ushered back to safe shores, all they think about is what they could manage to cook tonight - ignoring the fact there would be no dinner, only a hospital trip. There was still one last thing, though. They scoot closer to Agent Egeberg, lightly tapping him on the shoulder. nativani |🍸cameron 🍟 syd 23-Dec-22 09:17 PM
The boat ride would be uncomfortable as you bounce over the violent waves surging from the island epicentre, but you're so battered and bruised that you're numb to any jerk, or you're already fast asleep that your body merely wobbles about in your spot. After being out in the elements for days, and soaked for most of those for some teams, you're bundled in those reflective Mylar blankets provided in emergency aid to keep warm. The work is over for this mission. You watch its conclusion in real time as the remnants of the island gurgle and disappear into the lake. It's barely audible over the motor, like watching a silent movie, a muted video of an iceberg splintering to sea. The resulting whirlpool makes the route far more intrepid than the still waters those who left earlier experienced, but the boat prevails just as you have. You're back on solid ground - ground you know as home. The paramedics have been working on overdrive for the entire day transporting the injured to hospitals as if it became a public transport system. Your injured join, too, in their own ambulances after immediate attention is resolved. Egeberg is carried on a gurney into an ambulance once your goodbyes are complete. The movement of aid and support, of congratulations and cheers, of reunions and mournings, the soundscape is lively and warm, a vibrancy that you felt so deprived of. For those who were the first inhabitants of the island, how much did they miss this part of humanity? For now, you can close your eyes and simply listen. To the music of people, and living. (edited)

The lake is still and peaceful. The sky is clear. The world is no longer silent.

🌁 ISLE OF SILENCE / ✋│hands
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 23-Dec-22 03:25 PM
◉ YOU WAKE UP Gasping for air after a bloodcurdling feeling of being split in two. #Cut at the very centre The first thing you noticed, though, is that you’re no longer within the catacombs. The splash of a puddle beneath your feet, a [POOL OF RED][A SEA OF BLOOD]Above you the [SKY] shone [BRIGHTLY], but bereft of the warming blue you’ve grown accustomed to. It was a sickly [WHITE] colour, as if trying to blind you from any hopes of salvation to return home. The Blood Sea was vast, on the edges of the horizon you can see remnants of land, floating above it, all coloured [BLACK] like charcoal, as with the [TREES] that grew from it. Its wood, its leaves, all the same shade of obsidian. It rings around the edges like [FENCES] to keep you in. But at the centre, a single [ARM] coloured like the night sky protruding from the red sea, reaching out for the sky. It was still for a moment, But in your arrival it too [AWAKENS].[BURSTING IN A FOUNTAIN OF BLOOD, ROSE A BOUQUET OF ARMS]In its hands, various manners of [WEAPONS] are seen, ready to [PUNISH] you. #SPEARS #AXES #SWORDS #HAMMERS A Battle of the final hour. To prove to the world that you too, despite all odds, deserve to live.[COURT IS IN ORDER. THE JUDGE WILL NOW HEAR YOUR PLEA] At What Cost (Thunder) - FE3H ost

Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:40 PM
Oh, how awful it felt to be ripped apart at the seams, carved right into their center. Yet, there was a thrill to it, a horrible and wonderfully violent reminder of what it felt like to be alive. The sound that follows their gasping breaths is a laugh. They can't help but laugh. What else are they supposed to do in the face of this? Adrenaline feels hot in their veins, reminding them to fight and survive no matter the cost. The blood... ah. How many times were they going to see this scene, a canvas of sticky red beneath their feet? Maybe this was some kind of metaphor. Their gaze drifts upwards, arm instinctively raising over their face to shield their eyes from the blinding sky. Oh, Toto, they weren't in Kansas anymore. Landing on the Arm - no, Arms - Peregrine stops. So a fight it was going to be, then? They supposed they should be thankful they had been unscathed up until now. They would fight for their life, as they always have. But even they wonder if maybe they bit off more than they can chew. They grip their baton and knife tight in each hand. Sorry, Frankie. Maybe they won't be home to make dinner tonight after all. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Jamie Swanson (she/they) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:41 PM
How much more can her body even take? Jamie wonders this during and after every mission, being put through things she never imagined she'd experience. It feels like the only thing missing from her experiences bucket list is dying, albeit this brief moment feels like it's pretty close to that. She squints at the brightness of the white, taking a moment to take it all in. But not too long. Apparently they need to be judged now. By something with many hands, no less. She doesn't want to fight. She really doesn't. She's tired, she's all sticky from the blood, her arm is still in bad shape, she's worried about getting back home and feeding Red and getting groceries and catching that flight to see her family- But she won't just sit on her ass and do nothing. She needs to get out of here. Jamie gets back up on her feet and searches around her pockets for her knife. It must be here somewhere, it's always with her... @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
Doris Meadow Tiangco Viray BOT 23-Dec-22 03:45 PM
Blood. More and more blood. Doris grimaces at the sight at first, but quickly steels herself. This arm had weapons their batons would be no match against… but having this in her hand would hopefully be enough to get her close enough and grab something for herself. She pulls out the two scalpels she found for good measure too. Time was of the essence and she can’t let herself stand frozen, not ever again. She’s already been cut and bruised, what was one the risk of some more? She’d do anything to help others, to save them. She trudges through the puddles of blood and moves forward with a silent determination, looking for an area she can attack to try and grab a sword. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley 23-Dec-22 03:45 PM
#Don't let this case grow cold too. [YOU WAKE UP] @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8)
6
Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 23-Dec-22 03:47 PM
Hayden's felt this before, or something similar, she thinks. She's felt her brain tear apart from the seams in strands, felt her sense of reality shattered. Over and over. When she opens her eye, she almost feels like she's still dreaming. It still feels like she's in her own head. Hayden blinks, unfazed by the sea of blood and the stark white sky. Her own mental prison is crueler than the Judgement that fell before them. When it awakens, Hayden rises to her feet. The court is in order but who exactly is the defendant and who is the prosecuter? To who's laws were they to abide to but their own morals? Taking a step forward, Hayden's no stranger to testifying in court. But she wonders how sentient it is. "Misery loves company, what sort of retribution do you seek?" Fearless, she reaches out to grab a sword. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley
MIETTE (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 03:47 PM
Miette feels like she's being punished for being brave; she thinks only I can shape myself and- whatever this is, it says actually, so can I and tears her apart for it. She pats herself down when she feels whole once more, a cold chill down the back of her neck. She runs a hand over her face, looks at the abstract, liminal sight before her with a hand over her mouth. The courage is leaving her as quickly as it arrived. It's not worth it. It's not fair— the bouquet of arms grows and raises its weapons. How are they supposed to win against this? In comparison, they may as well be waving sticks. "...cmon," she slowly extends her hand, like a pile of limbs can hear her. "A-at least make it fair?" @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley (edited)
12
𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 03:55 PM
Sleeping would've been easier. Her eyes pry open almost involuntarily, called awake by anything but human. The milky-white of the sky is blinding; it reminds her of the glazed over eyes of a corpse. Which is what she'd be, if she didn't resurface. Bianca's body hurts. But she's still alive, so she still has to try. There's so many things she needs to do, a bucket list far from complete. Forcing herself out of murky, copper-red water, Bianca gasps and coughs, wheezing out the liquid from her lungs and sputtering to remember how to breathe. Staggering to her feet is a process, like a fawn learning how to walk. Trying to remember how her body moves, uncertain if that sensation of being split in two was real or not. She uses the crowbar as a makeshift cane, clutching the handle with both hands like a lifeline. Her wounded forearm throbs. Even if she couldn't get off of this island, she'd make the trip worth it. Show me everything. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 04:43 PM
How does she calm herself? Standing there, trembling like a leaf, watching her peers fight for their lives - She counts to 3, over and over, tries to steady her breathing. Bianca thinks of spaces that make her calm. The museum after hours. Her parents home. Her apartment. Listening to Saffron and Alexei bicker over their shared desk space. The smell of formalin. The sound of an old music box. She pulls the crowbar free from whatever could be called 'ground' in this nightmarish space, and stalks forward. Slow, steady. She'll bide her time, wait for an opening. Maybe, if she's lucky enough, she'll even be able to bring one of these hands home. As a souvenir. @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

MIETTE (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 04:51 PM
Oh. Oh, wow. It actually worked. She's exhaling another sort-of-laugh again, like in the room of flowers, but this time she's relieved, happy to still have a head on her shoulders. But what now? She watches the others run in, like it's that easy. They take weapons of their own, they carve into whatever fucked up flesh makes up this amalgamation of limbs. They fight for their lives. ◉ GENERAL COMBAT RULES
Just to make things go a little smoother and faster, if your action goes under these three categories, feel free to roll for them after you post! Otherwise, just type and @ me if you're unsure! Between the two choices, feel free to pick the higher roll if you want, or whatever fits
[ENGAGE]: roll STR/DEX # Offensive, Directly Opposing the anomaly in a Physical wau [ENDURE]: roll CON/MAG # Anything involving resolving yourself, defending yourself. May contain bonus mods depending on intention/player text [COMMUNE]: roll CHA/INT # Speaking/persuading/manipulating or Studying/Finding Weaknesses falls here (edited)
Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 23-Dec-22 05:24 PM
Hayden's grip tightens around the hilt of the sword, squeezing it much like she did Ophelia's hand when she couldn't see, taking hold of glimmering hope that can cut through darkness. Hikaru, didn't you make a promise? Did you forget? No, of course not. But it's always like this, the back and forth within her head. The endless loop of cowardice. All she knows is regret, all she knows is hurt. Parading around with the guise of an empath when it benefits her, her hands have ruined others more than they have helped. Such a vicious cycle of only getting worse, can the damned be saved or should they be punished? Every day she punishes herself with regret because she's afraid, because she knows forgiveness will break her, mercy will change her as a person. But Hayden wasn't afraid of forgiveness as she reached out for a second sword, not caring whether she deserved mercy or not. She grits her teeth when Peregrine takes impact, can this be reasoned with? Miette proved so not a moment before that. "Why are you doing all of this?" Hayden stands her ground for now, barking at the anomaly. "What do you want from us?" [COMMUNE] [CHA: 20] @santas shELFy 🍀 Patrick 🖋 Ashley

Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 05:31 PM
They feel the baton crack with the force that they put behind it to slam into the hand, keeping it from reaching them. The kitchen knife plunges in deep, and just as violently, they rip it out in a spray of blood. Suffer. I will rip you apart. The knife flings to the side as Miette pleads with the anomaly, somehow convincing it to forfeit its weapons over. Yes, this is it. This is what they desire, what they've been meant for. They were built for brutality. With their baton still withholding the bleeding hand, their free one stretches out, gasping onto the handle of an axe. It's familiar. It reminds them of the days of chopping wood with their father, bringing it down on log after log so they could enjoy a warm fire. A smile starts to form, and then they see the hammer come towards them. Fuck. They gasp sharp as the hammer connects, sending them to the ground. Ugh, so that's what it felt like, huh? Cruel irony, after their last mission of yielding an all-too-similar weapon. Well, they supposed they knew what it was like to be on the receiving end of that now. But it didn't matter. With a groan and stuttered curse under their breath, they push themself back up through the grit of their teeth. Get up again. Get up, get up, get up. No mercy for the wicked, and this thing was fucking vile. Ignoring the piercing pain in their ribs, they swing the axe up over head and down again on one of the hands. Just like daddy used to. ENGAGE - DEX: 22

MIETTE (she/her) BOT 23-Dec-22 05:35 PM

[THE GUILTY MAY NOW RISE ONCE MORE] #Player's Turn The time has come. @christmez eve 🐣 peregrine @deefrost 🌼 doris 🎸 rose @Jacket 🏨 MILF EMPORIUM 💀📞🕷 @andi 🪡 bianca (8/8) @pepomint 📸 jamie/shaun/darren @pugmas ✦ miette
Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 06:34 PM
A growl tears through their throat, inhuman in its force and sound. They put the full force of their stupid, too small body into the axe, digging it in deeper, deeper still into the arm. Their eyes are trained straight ahead, unwavering in their conviction, but they know when Hayden speaks it is not her. "You are nothing. Who the fuck are you to judge us?" They hiss, leaning closer to the anomaly. "People deserve to live their lives, no matter what regrets they have, and you took that from them. This isn't freedom! People deserve to make things right!" Their mind sticks to the splatted remains of a mother, who will never see her children again, who will never sleep beside her husband for another night and rise with him for another morning. Yes, there was rage. Yes, there was exhaustion. But there is always the chance to make things right, to let those mistakes guide you into making your life something better. They were brutal for the sake of kindness. They wanted to ruin the world for the sake of love. Everyone deserved a happy, fulfilled life. And this anomaly took that from these people. They will never forgive that. Blinded by their fierce, boiling rage - no, by their grief, their love for these people they didn't even know but they will mourn and fight for all the same - they clench their jaw, breathe in hard through their teeth. Their sneaker presses and digs into the arm as they rip the axe back out. With their mentor guiding their hand, they swing the axe straight down towards the EYE. ENGAGE - DEX: 23

𝗕𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗮 BOT 23-Dec-22 06:35 PM
Breath hitches, caught in her throat. A noise rises out from her chest in frustration - snarling through grit teeth. She nearly had it. Seems like the others are catching on, too. The eye is their target - and if it's arms would only get in the way of oncoming strikes, she'd do what she could to make the task easier for her coworkers. If strength could not work in her favour for violence, she'd simply try something else. She lurches for the limb still holding a weapon, trying to hold it in place by pinning the arm against her body with the crowbar. Maybe it would provide the opening Peregrine needed, maybe it wouldn't. But she had to try. ( ENGAGE - ATTACK 16) (edited)

Peregrine (any) BOT 23-Dec-22 07:54 PM
Their axe finds the mark, driving down with so much force that it splits the eye in twain (much like they were), splashing deep into the bloody sea and digging into the ground. They're drenched in red, breathing hard and trembling. Every breath hurts, stabbing into their heart, carving them open. The adrenaline keeps them numb to the true damage, for now. They sink to their knees, trembling and exhilarated hands still clutching to their axe. You won't hurt anyone any longer. It's a relief. Yet, it is an agony. They know there are countless people here who died, and their heart feels grief and anger and pain. These people did not die to a mindless, hungry beast, nor an anomaly that simply took control and forced them into disillusioned despair. These people died by the trappings of their own hearts, overcome by guilt and shame and regret for the mistakes they've made, senseless violence brought upon them simply for being human. These people deserved better than to die never knowing a better future for themselves. Peregrine breathes in deep, and out comes a sob. They did the best they can, the best they could ever do. Yet there was still more to be done; to return home, to cook dinner, to inform a family of the loss of a loving mother. There will always be more work to be done, but they're only one person, so they can only ever take it one step at a time. Their head tips back, tears of exhaustion and mourning and pain mixing in with the blood staining their face. They sniffle hard, watching as the scenery changes and the sky above them turns blissfully dark, soothing the strain on their eyes. They could go home, and could only hope the others would be able to do the same.

Dr. Hayden O'Connor BOT 23-Dec-22 10:03 PM
Ah, so that’s it. Hayden isn’t the nasty lone wolf she makes herself out to be. Hikaru runs ahead of the pack to lead the way like a star burning brighter than Polaris, cutting through darkness and anything that stood in her way. And like a star, she shines brightest when she’s about to burst with all her might. And all her might shatters through the first layer of armor. And together they pierced through the eye of the storm, seizing victory. There is but a moment of reprieve before they’re engulfed by darkness only to soon be cradled by a blanket of stars. Sin and guilt, it didn’t quite matter in the end. At the end of a supernova, there’s a black hole that traps everything. But life can still persist. It’s only human. That’s what you are, aren’t you Hikaru? Hayden puts herself on autopilot as she finally turns to the other detectives, dropping her swords as she rushes to their aid. 15:23
You wake up on your backs, water laps and licks at your sides as you start to realise the others around you starting to stir awake as well. The first thing you take note of is the [complete absence of fog,] the [clearest] vision you’ve had in the last 24 hours as you watch the stars twinkle in the pitch black night sky. #Yet, why does it feel as though your every move was being watched? The second? The second was the [complete lack of a siren’s wail.] Silence. Peace. Tranquillity. Yet the latter two hardly come to mind given its usual synonymous nature towards the absence of sound. The gentle snowfall only added to the uncanny sense of serenity. A white Christmas…? Pulling yourself up, you start to notice how [suffocating] your surroundings were: the sky pitch black save for the stars, the shallow [pool of blood] each of you were laying in only moments before and the distant [snowy] shores mocked you. The [six] of you stand in absolute silence, there is nothing here, no animals, no monsters, [no life.] Just you and your 5 other coworkers.

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 03:42 PM
A memory, tugging at the edges of his consciousness. He feels like he did back in January: chasing the elusive light of the Mriga, only to wind up on earth hard as concrete, and just as frigid. Memories of his time in the fae realm in its entirety dance with blurred colors in his mind's eye. What a fascinating world it was, simultaneously tranquil and rife with chaos. Tension so taut it could be plucked like the string of a harp. It reminded him of someone. Eyes coming open, sensation slowly regained, Maeron thought of them now. Not anything clear or comprehensible, but he thought of them; the sight of them at the house, the sight of them in the fog. His jaw clenches with a painful tightness once he sits up and sees the blood-- not just around him, but his coworkers as well. The newfound silence of the island did nothing to comfort his impression of the situation. If anything, it made it all seem all the more ominous. Like waiting for a death knell to toll. Tension like a harp indeed. MAG 7

Frankie Mane (he/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 04:09 PM
So many eyes. How many of them were one? Is each eye a unique voice? His pupils shrink, the light blinding him. You really are like stars, Frankie thinks, and it isn't so ill-fitting after all, that the night sky would have eyes. People used to pray in times like these for a god, a voice, anything. They'd read the stars for answers believing there was a higher being out there, watching them. As for Frankie, whether he was a believer or not-- he doesn't know. It doesn't matter to him. God was the face of a haughty, red-haired girl. She left him to pursue her own world. It took him 14 years to realize she wasn't god. He never thought of her as one in the literal sense, though Frankie viewed her aspirations, her dreams, her voice, as the guides themselves and framed it for what he saw. She was just a girl. He regrets making her feel lonelier than she already was. Regret doesn't come forth in the form of Jane, nor does it manifest in Meteor City. Regret is the god he worshipped who abandoned herself long ago. What do you mean I belong here? Why? Why should I stay? I still... ... have so much to say, have so many things to make up for... @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

8
Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 04:13 PM
A sharp laugh, ripped from his throat. Regret? Regret? Maeron was no ascetic. He drank. He indulged. He knew most of life's mortal pleasures, the satisfaction of the flesh. The only things keeping him sane. No. He had never denied himself the physical, the material. And it was not duty that kept him from indulging in someone more. That made him retreat from something more. They had been more than mere indulgence. They were virtue in the face of hedonism. Yet they were naive and dishonest with themself, ungrateful to a degree that was infuriating. Maeron couldn't stand being around them. Couldn't stand them. Peace had been corrupted by envy. There was no more peace to be had; he had tainted any potential for it. He was bound, but not by not to duty. He was bound to a sickening cycle of longing, destroying, and then acquiescence. Bound to the pessimism that did not let him dream of anything long lasting. Because things-- good things-- rarely lasted. Life was just about surviving. Being able to spend another day alive, another day indulging, just to cope with how little there was to be gained. The only thing Maeron denied himself: hope. That things would change. That he could have something that lasted. That he could be taken wholeheartedly into the embrace of anyone else. He had nothing. Anything he gained was transient. And he learned from the one time he fought against that disillusionment that it would only result in pain. No, he doesn't regret pushing away that momentary peace. What he regrets is having engaged with it in the first place, submitting to that siren song. He would never let it happen again. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
Soma Lee (He/him) BOT 23-Dec-22 04:14 PM
Of course he remembers. He remembers it so very clearly. Love is a strange thing, isn't it? It has that power, it only gives. Even by someone who's never received it, they can still give it away. His sister had so much love in her. She cared so much, even when he pushed her and everyone away. He always admired that. That day, even tired, she never stopped fussing over him. Nevermind his age, always treated him like her baby brother. Oh. OH. She would be so heartbroken. Are you sure you want to sign up for that crapshoot... detective agency? They don't have the best reputation, you know. I'll be fine. You worry about me too much. Haven't I gotten by just fine by myself all this time? He's going to hurt her again. He's promised her things that he couldn't keep. Is he even going to leave a body behind if he dies here? She's going to be all alone in his funeral. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 04:38 PM
"What do you think you're trying to offer me here?" Maeron hears himself say, feels himself say. His voice sounds hoarse, weakened. He doesn't think it should be, not when he's barely spoken this whole trip. But the exhaustion clinging to his body says something else. "Peace? Solace? Hope?" It was rather obvious: an anomaly eager to supply happiness or comfort or anything a person felt they lacked. That they wanted, but was absent. Maeron laughed again. It hurt. "I don't want anything." He laughs, and laughs. "I don't want anything from you, or anyone else. " Just so it could be taken again? No. He was no fool. There was no such thing as a life of endless pleasure. Maybe for those in a different position, coming from different places. But it was too late for him. It had been to late since he was born. It's not like the anomaly could give him what would make him happy. Because he didn't even know himself what that would be. And he never would. He wasn't happy back then. He wasn't happy with them. And he wasn't happy now. So there was only to survive. "You can't give me what I want." It's venomous now, the way he says it; the laughter is gone. "Don't pretend like you can." @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena

Maeron Al Najjar BOT 23-Dec-22 05:14 PM
"..." Whatever emotion be might be feeling having come out of that stupor, it's impossible for him to identify. He doesn't feel like he's won anything or against anyone. As disconcerting as it is to see an eye so similar to his own, it's no more familiar than his reflection is-- that is to say, just enough to spark a modicum of recognition. He gets up, pulling his body from the wretched pool of blood. His lips curl into a sneer as he gazes back at the floating eye. Was it supposed to be symbolic? Representative? He saw no reason to touch it or take it; he didn't want some grim eyeball fashioned by a monster after his own heart. He has quite enough of shadows nipping at his heels. He has had enough of being chased, for one reason or another, for better or for worse. Nothing was going to change. He was just going to survive another day. "Cast your ridiculous judgement on someone else." His life didn't belong to anyone. Even if that included himself. But he could endure keeping it that way if it meant not having to bear the pain of loss ever again. He wrenches himself away, not giving the eye a second glance. @sAInt niKOlas🎅 🗿 olwen 🎺 rena
